Reviews.Title: “Great Choice!”
Reviews.Author: Sofia M
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel mainly because of the great reviews here, since it seemed like the best budget option for Singapore, which included breakfast. the hotel is close to the MRT, VERY clean, very nice rooms, not too big, but very convenient with very comfy beds. Buffet breakfast was ok for a 3 star hotel, with decent selection of food. more asian than european choices, however, it is excellent if you compare it to average 3 star place breakfast in Thailand. I first freaked out when we walked to the hotel from the MRT station for the first time, because the area seemed to be outskirts and unfriendly, however, it is totally fine. and it is only 2 MRT stops away from the City Hall, which is Singapore downtown. All in all, we had a great stay and would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Quick Overnight”
Reviews.Author: Dennis C
Reviews.Content: After reviewing many hotels in Singapore we decided to stay at the Aqueen Hotel Lavender. It is one of the more economical hotels for the quality. Very clean, decent size room and bath with good window light. The staff in the hotel and cafe are very friendly. We went to this hotel after being on a cruise. When we arrived our room was not ready, so they stored our luggage in a locked room. We ate lunch and dinner in the attached cafe and the food is very good. Since we had a 5:15 am flight the next morning, the lady who waited on us at dinner volunteered to fix us a breakfast to take with when we left the hotel at 2:30 am. The breakfast of tuna sandwich, banana, and hard boild egg for each of us was waiting when we checked out. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel, but next to singapore casket”
Reviews.Author: Olie92
Reviews.Content: Nice room, a bit small, but well designed and well-lit. Very clean also with decent breakfast. Taxi is also easy to get while MRT is 10 mins walk. the only minus is the location, next to singapore casket.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: F35Captain
Reviews.Content: Will stay here again! small rooms, great breakfast, and awesome staff.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Cozy but....”
Reviews.Author: Judezz
Reviews.Content: Got there for my second honeymoon. About 15 minutes walking from MRT Lavender. Next to Singapore Casket, but it' no big deal for me. Small room with complete amenities, for young couple it's a great choice...but not for families and big size person. I'm a petite person, but i got my elbow bruised when i washed my hair at tiny bathroom (attention : the bathroom partition is a glass wall with some blur sticker). When i choose this hotel, i thought i got modern room with quiet environment. But you can hear noises from street an some annoying people next door. My husband called resepsionist 3 times because at 3AM next door guest still laughing and singing, but no respond at all.

Reviews.Title: “Located just outside city centre with great transport links but rooms space limiting.”
Reviews.Author: Satinder S G
Reviews.Content: Arrived on Christmas Eve 2011 with a late booking via Asiarooms.Com.A premium rate as Singapore is a massive (commercial) hub for Festive lIghts,street parades and events but no obvious "Christian" aspect. Reasonable breakfast on open plan terrace with outdoor pool.Modern room but limited lIghtening,comparatively small with dark furnishing.Wi-fi only connected in lobby although claimed to be available in rooms.Secure car parking quite reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, appreciate the breakfast and free internet access”
Reviews.Author: SJCT
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 2 nights. I believe this is a relatively new hotel. Rooms and amenities are adequate. Limited TV channels, its good though that internet access is free so we resorted to that for entertainment. Good value since for an all in 150SGD, breakfast for 2 is already included and our 3yr old still eats for free. Not exactly near the tourist destinations in singapore and so you have to travel by train or bus to these places. Location feels "lonely", nothing much to do there. The 10 minute walk for others is fine, but not for those travelling with pre-schoolers or elders. That's about 600m of walk and can take longer and tiresome. There are two bus stops nearby, might as well explore these for travel options.

Reviews.Title: “A good value hotel for Singapore”
Reviews.Author: WorcesterWanderer6
Reviews.Content: This hotel is handy for Little India and Lavender metro station; both are about 10 minutes walk from the hotel. Our room was modern and comfortable. The bathroom was small but certainly adequate and clean. Breakfasts here was OK but not an extensve range of foods compared to others. The staff here were very helpful. Lavender Food Court is very close (about a minutes walk) and provides a number of very good value eating options.

Reviews.Title: “Location within walking distance to MRT”
Reviews.Author: elgor
Reviews.Content: This hotel was about 10 minutes walk from MRT. The room was small but adequate. There was a very wide window ledge where you could put your suitcases. We had twin beds and one bed was flush against this ledge. There was coffee and tea making facilities, fridge and a room safe. The room was clean. Bath towels, hand towels and a shower mat were provided. Two bottles of water were provided complimentary each day. We had breakfast included and while it was adequate, it was mainly asian dishes. You could not get eggs cooked to your liking and there was no bacon. Each day there were extremely hard boiled eggs and one other egg dish. Fresh fruit and fruit juice were provided. The staff were friendly and check in was quick and efficient. We would stay here again. I thought it was good value for money considering how expensive Singapore can be.

Reviews.Title: “VALUE FOR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: barrie m
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel not your hilton but good value, rooms are compact but hey how much room do you need its got what you need TV,BATHROOM,BED AND FREE INTERNET. Also you get a free buffet breakfast every morning. Now the location is not too bad close to the subway, big shopping plaza,all in walking distance. If you want to see the real Singapore warts and all this is a good place to start its safe and you see the real people,its not your Orchard road but then thats not all its cracked up to be either it just costs more, so i would say give it a go, subway 5 minutes walk easy to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roney1974
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here this week. For me - this is a great 3.5 star hotel in Singapore. Location is really good. Lavendar MRT station 10 minutes walk. Little India 10 minute walk. Right side of the city for the airport. Re hotel itself rooms are small but we did not find any problems. The breakfast This is a typical 3-3.5 star hotel - no frills so if looking for 4 star accommodation at this price u will be disappointed. We thought it was really good hotel in a good location to get yourself into the city. Breakfast was typical 3 - 3.5 star hotel stuff - not fancy but we thought it was fine. I would ask for a room on a higher level. We were only on L2 and a little bit of noise. The Lavendar Hawkers market is also across the road and we ate there 3 times - twice to grab a lunchy snack and once for dinner when exhausted.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, but great stay overall!”
Reviews.Author: CamilleAnn
Reviews.Content: Hotels in Singapore are really expensive, so we were happy to find these decently priced hotel in a great location! Really close to Little India and there is a hawker stall around the corner. The train is a close walk and some buses around just outside the door! And Singapore is the safest tourist cities in the world, so it was easy to walk around without considering the time of night. We had a deluxe room with a really comfortable queen bed. It was very clean, but hardly any room to walk. We had to be creative and hang out things all around the room, otherwise we would have to walk ovr our things. The bathroom is big a good size, but the door is a glass door that's partially frosted. Same goes for the shower; there is a frosted glass window dividing the room and the shower. And there is no vent in the bathroom, so depending on how comfortable you are with your travelling partner, this can be a little too intimate... and smelly. Breakfast is complimentary and really good. I don't eat meat and each of the 7 nights I was there they had a decent selection of food I could eat. Wifi is free and is a wonderful amenity. I don't usually need my room serviced while I'm staying less than a week, but they provide two free bottles of water, so if you don't get your room serviced make sure you get that water!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable but extremely small”
Reviews.Author: VD7833
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night on business with a friend. Wasn't difficult to find but its a good 10min walk to the closest MRT station. If you have luggage its just easier to get a taxi and its on the main read so its easy to find. I had made reservations earlier so check in relatively quick. The hotel itself is modern with basic amenities. However the room we had was extremely small. We had 2 single beds and there wasn't much space to put our luggage. The room was small and the bathroom smaller! There was hardly any place to move around. It felt extremely claustrophobic. On the plus side the rooms were clean, there was free wifi. For a short stay I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel with budget price”
Reviews.Author: jthendra
Reviews.Content: Just stayed there on Feb 2012; i don't know about the price since we used event coordinator for this occasion - i heard it's a round 100 SGD. The room is comfortable with 32 inc TV (channel is limited), small refrigerator, safety box, desk and nice and firm bed. The bath room: closet is ok but shower space is limited; towel and toiletries is ok. Breakfast is nothing special and limited. Location is near Lavender Food Court, some KTV clubs, spa and massage; Lavender MRS is around 10 minutes walk. All in all is very good considering the price. Tips: do not stay in Level due to smoking floor.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money in an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: anth0888
Reviews.Content: Well this hotel must be honest exceeded our expectations. We booked our stay through Agoda at a very good 110ish USD for two people a night. Singapore is a very expensive place for accommodation (unless you chose hotels / backpacker places) so finding this place at this price, in the location it was is a STEAL! The hotel is pretty much right in the middle of the two parallel MRT stations. To the west of the hotel is Farer Park MRT station (NE8) on the purple line. Whilst to the east of the hotel is Lavender MRT Station (EW11) on the green line. About 8 minutes to the city centre. Trains come every 5 minutes, always on time. It’s about equal distance to both (depending on where you want to go). It takes about 10 minutes walk, but we found this no problem. The reception staff was friendly and everything is modern, clean and welcoming (hence why it's a steal). As per many other comments in regards to room size, we were a bit taken back about the size of the room, but we soon put this into context, as Singapore is quite compact. The room is good sized when put into perspective. Flat screen TV, clean and had comfy beds. We managed to oversleep because we found it so comfortable haha. Our only issue was the bathroom 'frosted' glass room divider. The frosted glass effect makes things a bit awkward if staying with others. Also there was quite a gap between the glass entrance door . So when we stayed, we would have one of us step out of the room, so it didn't become a peep show. If this was resolved it would be perfect. Apart from that, the breakfast was the usual fare with eggs and other foods, which are rotated on a daily basis. The hotel is located on one of the main roads, so taxis can be obtained if needed easily. The area that the hotel is in is very safe and not shady or suspect. Safe to walk at night. There’s a few nice eateries nearby, 7/11’s and also a few internet cafes etc. Overall we were very pleased with this hotel. If I travel to Singapore in the future, i would most certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Small modern room, tiny bathroom with few amenities, located next to casket firm.”
Reviews.Author: Humouresque
Reviews.Content: Over-priced for the quality of room & location, with small bathroom sized for skinny person. Poor noise insulation. About 10 minutes walk to the nearest MRT station. Lavender Food Square, a 3-minute walk away, has a decent selection of local eateries. Taxis are readily available on the main road. Efficient front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money in an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: rob1959
Reviews.Content: Our third visit to Singapore and to the Aqueen Lavender and we have not been let down yet. As far as value for money in what is a very expensive city for hotels, this hotel is great. Yes of course if you care to spend twice as much you can get better and more luxurious but isn't that always the case. The location is ideal within walking distance giving access to some of the great Indian restaurants in Little india along all the atmosphere of what is our favourite area in singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place, staff, rooms and price.”
Reviews.Author: Outta W
Reviews.Content: Though it was a bit of a trek from the subway, I was very pleased with this place. It was clean and just perfect for me my wife and our two year old. The breakfast was good and when good ran out they had more within minutes. The reason the food ran out wasn't the fault of the staff, but because a party of fourteen emptied nearly everything out.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean small boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: thePaulhongkong
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as it's very close to my office in Singapore and was fed up with the V Hotel where I normally stay as it's way too busy. This is a nice clean option with pleasant rooms though without a gym or pool which the lavender has. Rooms are comfortable though mine was very small and it was a pleasant stay. Breakfast was limited and a bit disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms ... but Very very nice”
Reviews.Author: kapoorsaurabhk
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean room... a bit small in size, but was not much of a problem as we were out most of the time. Breakfast served was also nice... Stayed here for 3 nights in Feb-Mar 2011. The Lavender MRT station is around 10-12 minutes walking distance from it. Has a cemetary a block away .. but it was not an issue for us ! All in All.. nice for the price .. infact much better ! Thumbs up !

Reviews.Title: “Affordable in an expensive city like Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Greg E
Reviews.Content: I am a repeat customer maybe 6 times in the past 12 months. Tried VHotel lavender as a change.. going back to AQueen next trip.. Bed a little short for longer guests. Room best suited to a single traveller. Staff friendly always clean

Reviews.Title: “Good location (near hawker market for food), clean, quiet rooms, not too expensive.”
Reviews.Author: JohnMcGrathMI
Reviews.Content: This hotel is mid-range but represents good value for money. Its proximity to the Lavender Hawkers' Market and Little India mean it is well placed for short stays. We always stay here now when passing through Singapore. The staff are helpful and the wireless Internet is a great asset. Breakfasts are nothing to rave about but they do the job.

Reviews.Title: “A nice and efficient hotel, though somewhat overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: Elias77
Reviews.Content: A competently and efficiently run hotel in a decent location. Nice rooms, helpful staff, tentatively adequate breakfasts, fast wireless internet. Somewhat overpriced - but so are many things in Singapore. Bathrooms are inconveniently designed - after shower the water remains splashed all around the bathroom floor (despite curtains etc.). Breakfasts were adequate - but only tentatively so. Food selection was rather meagre for their room prices.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for money”
Reviews.Author: travel_girl23_08
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice between February 12 to 20, 2011. Initially for 4 nights and then for 2 nights after we returned from our 2 days trip from Malaysia. Both stay very pleasant. Both rooms very clean and bed comfortable. Buffet breakfast which was included, had a good variety of choices daily. Staff was friendly and welcoming. Lavender station 15-20 minutes walk. Overall a pleasant stay and will definitely come back to Aqueen Hotel Lavender. I know other reviewers said the rooms especially the bathrooms are a little bit on a small side, but both rooms we had were fine. Considering my fiance is 6ft. tall!

Reviews.Title: “2nd time round - still satisfactory.”
Reviews.Author: wdominic
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay after being back to Singapore in the span of a year. Aqueen hotel is still popular among travelers. We noticed that inevitably there were very minor signs of wear in the fixture and fittings but none that bothered us. Since we drov to Singapore, would like to report that there are approx 6 car park bays (first come first serve basis) that we got to utilize everyday. The staff - Still very friendly and helpful staff. We would still consider to stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Christopher88
Reviews.Content: Didnt actually manage to stay at Aqueen as Qantas rerouted my flight to Bangkok. However de to the mixup the service staff at the hotel were exceptionally understanding when they didnt need to be. Thanks guys.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money paid”
Reviews.Author: MengHoi
Reviews.Content: The services offered by the staff of the hotel is great. Worth the value paid. Complimentary breakfast are served every morning. If you are on a budget stay in a room with private bathroom. This is definitely a great choice. With access to Lavender MRT Station within 15-20 minutes of walking distance. And Lavender Food Court just opposite the main entrance of the hotel offering 24 hours of Singaporean food. You might wanna watch out for a certain stalls on their prices. One major turndown is that the hotel is surrounded by funeral parlours. Singapore casket is located right beside the hotel. To those who doesn't mind waking up listening to chants and prayers by temples and having a church within the same street. This is definitely the choice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Clean Hotel with Free Buffet Breakfast! Will definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: timmytime2011
Reviews.Content: My husband and 20 month old baby stayed in this hotel last May 2011. We chose this hotel because of the many great reviews. And we were not disappointed at all. The hotel had a nice welcoming scent when you enter and the front office staff were very friendly and helpful. I love the modern look of the hotel. The room may be small for some people, but it was enough for my family. The long ledge along the window of our standard Queen room allowed us to put all of our 3 luggages. The room was very clean. I expected the bathroom to be small from the reviews, so i was ok with it. The frosted glass of the bathroom walls didn't bother us, as we were a family. We were travelers that were more concerned with cleanliness and how new the hotel is, so with that, i give this hotel a 2 thumbs up! Bonus! We love that the room came with a free breakfast buffet! we were very satisfied with what we got every morning. Some reviews said the breakfast wasn't good. I disagree. They offered a couple of hot items like scrambled eggs, ham/sausage, noodles, fried rice, etc. So it wasn't just any ordinary coffee and donut breakfast. We were very very happy with our stay at this hotel and will go back again if we had a chance to go back to Singapore for another vacation. Note: it's about a 15 walk to the nearest MRT station. We're used to walking so it wasn't too bad for us even with a baby. If you get hungry, there's a nearby food plaza at the back of the hotel with a variety of food stalls to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Not exactly "budget" - Traveling friends beware of toilet!”
Reviews.Author: sflea
Reviews.Content: Many reviews have said that this is a budget hotel, but it is not the cheapest hotel that you can get in Singapore. As a regular 2-star budget hotel traveler, this was a bit nicer than the usual 'cheap-and-good' stays. However the hotel is clean, pleasant and relatively close to the nearest MRT (10 min brisk walk), so no complaints there. They also have parking facilities for those driving in Singapore (though they are rather limited to 6-7 parking bays). The rooms are a tad small though, but sufficient nonetheless. One thing to note, for those traveling with friends or acquaintances, beware! The toilets do not have solid walls, they actually have full-height frosted window panes which leave NOTHING to the imagination when you are in the shower. So unless you are traveling with your partner, this creates some very uncomfortable situations. There's hardly any room to escape when your friend is in the shower...

Reviews.Title: “Stay here only if you're on a very tight budget”
Reviews.Author: 1GuyNamedJoe
Reviews.Content: The room smells of dampness. The bed is rock hard and the room is run down.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and sufficient”
Reviews.Author: Edcanstay
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an indifferent area; not in the centre of town, but not too far away. Singapore is expensive for hotels, and for the price this hotel is ok. The rooms are very small, the bathrooms also small, and somewhat impracticle in design, but a side effect from being so small i think. the staff are efficient, but not overly friendly. They are strict about check-in/out times. Breakfast is simple, average quality, but adequate. There are two food courts within 2 minutes walk, and taxi's are easy to get from the main road outside. Ok for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lenny37
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located along lavender street. The nearest mrt is a 15mins walk away but may not be convenient for those with alot of luggage. There are plenty of buses nearby to get into town. 5 mins cab ride into town. Walking distance to little india. Food court within 5mins walk with lots of nice local choices. 7-11 store nearby. Rooms are small but clean. This is not a 5star hotel. Price range generally alright during non convention periods in singapore. Comes with free wifi and breakfast. Breakfast range may not be extensive but enough to start the day. Staff are generally friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Mudit_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Aqueen Lavender for 2 days in November. Overall, a great budget hotel. The room was compact but self sufficient. I took a queen size double bed which was ok for me. The room is equipped with a TV which has 5 or so channels, a dressing mirror, enough storage, even a tea and coffee machine, and a attached bath and WC. Despite the small size, the room is quite neat and clean and does not lack storage, mostly due to excellent space saving storage modules. The hotel is always kept very neat and clean. One piece of improvement- the buffet breakfast can be made to keep warm throughout. The place is a 10-minute walk from the Lavender MRT station and 2-minutes from the bus stop. Great place for 2 people to stay in a room if you intend to spend most of your time outside the hotel. If you want to spend some time lazing around in the room, you may want a bigger room, if your budget allows.

Reviews.Title: “Best well priced hotel in the lavender area”
Reviews.Author: josbeeck
Reviews.Content: Arrived very late and front office staff was most helpfull and very efficient. They got me to my room within a few minutes. The room very clean and all necessary amenities were in the bathroom. I called housekeeping and they were there in a flash. Very impressive. The breakfasr was good only the actual breakfast room was a bit small for the big number of people. However let this not deter you just go for breakfast after 8.30. The location of the hotal is fantastic. Surrounded by many eating places. The MRT AND BUSES ARE CLOSE BY.. i WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL

Reviews.Title: “Happy stay”
Reviews.Author: sunip2
Reviews.Content: Pros Clean and well maintained,clean sheets,nice bed,decent bathroom, relatively new hotel Close to little India(good for Indians) and Mustafa Mall Lavender food court is just across(Only chinese fare though) Courteous and friendly staff Free Wifi internet Cons A little away from MRTS stations(Farrer park and Lavender street MRTS are atleast 10mins walk) Buses are available though. Most taxi drivers dont know the hotel Regular rooms are tight on space,bathrooms specially so.But deluxe rooms are better and have more space. On the whole, just right for the tourist who is out the whole day and is using the room only for a good night sleep

Reviews.Title: “Impersonal and far from centre”
Reviews.Author: NuriaBarcelona
Reviews.Content: Prices in Singapore are mad so it took us a while to get this reasonably priced hotel (aprox.100€ night). Hotel is quite far from the city centre and 15 minutes walk to the train station (Lavander). So, prepare yourself for walking quite a lot or face the expensive taxis (15€ to city centre). Hotel is close to Little India area and has a funerary services nearby. Rooms are very small but clean and modern. Breakfast is poor and staff lacks personality and kindness. Overall I would not recommend this hotel as it is bad located, it is impersonal and it is not good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Tourist from India”
Reviews.Author: shashin_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed during 27th & 28th Nov. 11 in a group of 15people from India. It was a pleasant and comfortable stay with your hotel, we enjoyed room accommodation, food as well as hospitality. Even we loved to travel in Singapore the place full of discipline, sense of traffic, green zone environment the most essential. Only the point we touched was drinking water the vital fact we were very much dependent every were. Rest we love to sing Singapura....... Singapura.......... we love you Singapura.... Shashin, Daxa, Shobhana from Rajkot, India.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for money, and great staff”
Reviews.Author: derek s
Reviews.Content: I often travel to SIngapore and find the selection process of a hotel frustrating. They're either too expensive or don't have internet included, or internet but no breakfast etc. I settled upon the Aqueen Lavender not having stayed there before and was delighted with the hotel over my 11 night stay, and that's a long stay. The staff were very helpful, the rate very affordable for this period, and included both internet and breakfast. The location was fine, around the corner from Little India, and a food court across the road, easy. The hotel is basically new, and the rooms, although small, perfectly appointed, and quiet. The staff were even good enough to rush a porter out to the airport with my passport when i left it in a safe...and he made it on time. Very impressed, and I can recommend highly. Derek Melbourne Australia

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: arvam
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly...Miss Mary at the breakfast took special care that we don't make mistake in choosing the food, as we are vegetarian...Auntie Rafida did wonderful housekeeping,very clean and well done...the boys at the reception too were very supportive in advising a tour in the city...overall great job..rooms were cosy...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel after a 12 hour flight.”
Reviews.Author: burtons28
Reviews.Content: I thought I'd put a review on here as tripadviser was so helpful in booking all my hotels for my 3 weeks travel to Singapore, 3 stops in Oz and Hong Kong, When we got to the hotel from the airport the look of the hotel from the outside looked good, when entering, all the staff were so helpful, good to get out of the heat as it was 33 degrees outside night and day, The rooms are small as everyone else has written but everything is new, clean and to hand. The hotel is a good 25 minutes walk from the Singapore eye or 5 minutes by taxi, Loved this city so if and when I come back I'd recommend this hotel to friends and family staying in this city for a couple of days. When you step out of the hotel you are straight onto a main road but you dont really hear it from your room, we took a walk all around the area and found a nice restaurant, theres a lot of family run restaurant all around that spill onto the walkways and all smell amazing. Well worth a good 4 of the 5 great value! Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “when i return back for the next visit in singapore i may come back to this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: Wang29
Reviews.Content: the staffs are friendly, specially front desk, all the in formations that you need is provide for you as much as they can, room is small but clean and enough for two person

Reviews.Title: “Service is excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: BubblyGerl
Reviews.Content: Friendly staffs especially reception..prompt service.The breakfast is good and really hope to stay again even though room is quite small...

Reviews.Title: “hmm, yeah ok..”
Reviews.Author: chipopi
Reviews.Content: Spent the F1 Grand Prix week end there. Check in was fast and good, nice smiling receptionists. Rooms are really tiny and and the bathroom smelled like pee although it was clean. no view at all. Breakfast in the morning was OK and included in the room rate. Location is fine, 12-14 SGD away from the marina bay. Can sighsee Little India, it is very close. Budget hotel, all is fine except the smell.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Marialine
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful short stay in Singapore for business and check out early to the small room , but very clean room, Singapore is the most expensive palace in the world to visit. The bath room is small than Vietnam, but clean, the main road very noisy,

Reviews.Title: “Quaint SG "Budget" Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TobeyK
Reviews.Content: I don't know if there's a hotel category called "budget" boutique hotels, but if there was one, then this hotel fits the bill. Lobby/Lounge/Restaurant area was nicely decorated and the rooms, while small were clean. Look out for that funky shower - should be nice for couples. The surrounding area kinda offered a glimpse of Singapore - a nearby hawker foodcourt and small family owned establishments in sidestreets around Lavander St. prepared you for the walking that one needs to do if you're in the Lion City. The only drawback is the "15min" walk to the Lavander MRT station. That's a lengthy walk, especially if you're carrying shopping bags. Still, it's a pretty nice neighborhood and was only 2 stations away from City Hall (good jump off point). Last recommendation is to take the 2 day Hippo tour ticket - aside from being a tour bus that goes through major attractions, it helps set your itinerary especially if you have a tight schedule to follow. Jump off at the ff locations: 1) Marina Bay - pay the man to get to the top, it's worth it. 2) Little India and Chinatown - two very diverse neighborhoods in a single city 3) Sentosa - buy Universal Studio tickets online to avoid the long queue 4) Raffles Hotel - nice colonial architecture 5) Orchard Road - don't buy anything.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended for budget traveller”
Reviews.Author: freespiritedtraveler
Reviews.Content: It is right smack in the corner for Tyrwhitt and Lavender road so expect to hear buses and trucks from outside your bedroom. Rooms are kindda small but manageable for Asians like me. The bathroom has smoked glass contrary to what others say as see-thru doors. Near Lavender Station (Green Line MRT) by a 10 minute walk. Or hop into bus 133 to Boon Keng Station (Purple Line MRT) to whichever destination you want to go to.

Reviews.Title: “not that great”
Reviews.Author: dcp772000
Reviews.Content: In my opinion, most of the previous review are overrating this hotel. In a nutshell, it is a (not so cheap) budget hotel, with some embellished furniture. It is a good 15 minutes walk from the nearest underground station, up and down uneven sidewalks and across busy roads, not pleasant if you are carrying heavy luggage. Yes, you can call a taxi, but let's be honest, if you are choosing a hotel in this price range you probably prefer to save that money. The are where teh hotel is also a quite dull one in next to a very busy road. Only positive is that with a 20 minutes walk you are in the colurful Little India, and that next to the hotel there is a local food court. The rooms are very small, and the bathroom is so small that you will struggle to close the door without having to enter the shower. The bathroom is actually a glass cubicle. This is not the first time I see one of them, but while these features normally give an edgy/modern feeling to the property, this one was just dull and cramped. The shower has actually a curtain, not a glass door, wich funtion is to separate it from the actual toilet pot. It could have been cleaner, especially - again - the bathroom. We had a view on the (very close) building next door, amousing if you are interseted in your pensioner neighbour evening hygene routine. Breakfast was aiming to satisfy some western taste, but in my opinion it was not trying that hard. I rank it between the worst I have tried. Definetly not staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Total Ripoff, In My Opinion”
Reviews.Author: watchourstep
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a 15 minute walk from the metro, which is then another (at least) 2 stops into the heart of Singapore. So allot minimum 30 minutes to get anywhere you want to go. The rooms are the size of a shoebox, and in our experience the cleanliness was disgraceful given the price (see the photo of the bathroom door I have - absolutely vile - and there was hair on the sheets, etc). The floors (other than the lobby) either smell like cigarette smoke or intense mildew (I do not know the last time they cleaned their carpets). Unfortunately, that extends to the rooms as well - we had to move rooms because our first smelled so badly mildewey it was unbearable, and the bathroom was even worse than our second room. Also - the bathroom doors are lightly frosted glass, so you watch your roommate do EVERYTHING. This has to be the worst design choice ever. We have stayed in other hotels with the same concept, but at least in them the frosting was stronger and the toilet wasn't a foot away from the bed, separated only by that glass. I know SIngapore is expensive, but for $100/night what you get at this hotel is unacceptable. In any other city in SE Asia this place would cost 1/3 of the price at the most. Spend the extra few bucks and stay at the V Jellicoe - its directly above the metro stop and looks much, much nicer. If I paid $30/night I'd still probably be skeeved out by the mildew smell and lack of real cleanliness here. If you paid me $30/night I might consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fair price, bad location”
Reviews.Author: Jan_Zlin
Reviews.Content: Considering Singapore average price level it was good deal. Cleanliness and staff was good, however hotel is very far from LRT station (approx. 20 min by foot). Possible is to go by bus (Nr. 133 is very useful for city center tours) or taxi. Rooms are small but good equipped, including tea/cofee corner and wardrobe. Toiletries was also supplied. Breakfast room is only a small bistro, easy to full by couple of guests. WiFi available, working.

Reviews.Title: “NIce Hotel but very small rooms. not enough to put 2 suitcases”
Reviews.Author: mungra
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean and friendly staf. No breakfast en verry thinny rooms. Dont know were to leave our 2 suitcases . Not near to the centre but for food there are good options in the area. They provide free calls in Singapore Area.

Reviews.Title: “OK but with some issues”
Reviews.Author: Frank M
Reviews.Content: This is a newish small hotel located in a rather inconvenient area. Reception staff were mostly good, friendly and helpful. Some of the other staff were surly and sacarstic. The rooms are small but clean and new. However, there are some issues: Air-con was hardly powerful enough to deal with the fierce tropical heat. Beds are small and short. Tiny bathroom cannot be locked and one can see through the glass wall and door -- so it is highly inappropriate to stay with anyone except your spouse or partner. There's no sound insulation -- the room is always noisy from outside noise.

Reviews.Title: “Small & Clean”
Reviews.Author: Hill298570
Reviews.Content: I book this hotel because of high recommend review in tripadvisor. The room is quite small with many bright lights, Switch on all the lights , you won't feel the air-cond in the room. The bed is quite short, my husband have to squeeze his neck to sleep on it and collect the pillow few times in the whole night. Hence, if you are a tall person, it will be little bit hard for u for having a good sleep. The hotel is just next to the highway, you will feel the rooms little bit shake when there is heavy car pass by the road. Overall , the room is clean . The price is reasonable for me compare to other budget hotel. The big different between them are they provide you wife free in the room, and a large window. There is a lavender food court just few minutes walk from the hotel, distance to the nearest MRT (Lavender MRT) is about 10 minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, room was bigger than expected”
Reviews.Author: cristinahSydney
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of good reviews on trip advisor and was not disappointed. check in was quick,and the room was bigger than expected (perhaps because I had a rear room on the corner of the building. The bathroom was small and functional but note: no special toilettries. The room (507 i think) had an extra bit of room between the bedroom and the bathroom with a window seat. It's furnished in a nice modern way, and the staff lent me a local adaptor for my phone. Everything felt fresh and modern and recently refurbished. I was very pleased with my stay (overnight only). the breakfast wasn't sensational though. I'm not sure it's suitable for families as the kids may not like the food. It's within a pleasant walk to Little India and Arab St. the reception area was plain but cool, and the hotel felt very well-run. There is no 'bling', it's a kind of neutral, no fuss business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and efficient”
Reviews.Author: Gonzague1979
Reviews.Content: Sleek, modern hotel with all mod cons. Rooms are typically Singapore size but have everything you need but are clean and well maintained. Having stayed in a Hotel 81 previously, it's miles better with a good buffet breakfast included. The hotel is well located if you're wanting to take a coach over to Malaysia, and is also nearby small shops and food halls if you want to eat elsewhere. Customer service is on the brusque side, but if you're prepared to look beyond that then it's good value at S$60/night B&B.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: rehkow
Reviews.Content: Pros - room was simply nice for its cost, great value! 2nd best so far...next to 8 suites! - Food was "ok" since it was free. BK was better, though not that bad since it was free! - Wifi was fast! had the access point/extender right above our door! - Hawker house nearby, hospital as well and lots of taxis! Cons - Make sure to decide before your stay if you will be extending for a couple of hours more since they tend to be full! - Staff a bit stiff yet accommodating - Walls or Door was too thin? you can really hear people talking, closing their doors - Cable was boring with about 10-20 channels only? CNN and Discovery were the only channels to watch, the others were either in a different language or simply boring. No NBA, no HBO, no AXN! - Shower room was just too small for my size, a tub wont fit in there. no spray/bidet/beday!?

Reviews.Title: “Good value Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: yotsmn
Reviews.Content: We had read mixed reviews on this hotel but must say we were very satisfied with our stay and wouldn't hesitate to stay again. Contrary to some other reports we found the reception staff to be quite friendly and the young lady managing during the day was very helpful Pros: Free WIFI, nice clean room, large enough to store our two cases - we placed them on the window ledge which had ample room to accommodate them. Bed was firm but comfortable and shower had an adjustable height, good pressure and constant hot water. We also heard no traffic noise from our room on the 3rd floor, or noise from guests in adjoining rooms. Room came equipped with adjustable aircon, safe, soap, shampoo dispenser in the shower, small work desk, wardrobe with 4 coat hangers, tea/coffee making facilities and a LCD TV with plenty of English speaking channels. Buffet breakfast was also all we could have asked for eggs, hash browns, baked beans, sausages, ham, rice, noodles, toast, cereal and fruit juices. Selection varied the two mornings we ate. Some people have complained about the distance to Lavender Station but we found it to be very convenient, only about a 10 minute walk away and then a quick trip either into the city or 30 minutes directly to the airport the latter fare being only about $AU1.50 per person. There were also several food halls nearby with a good selection of cheap meals for around $SGD3-$4. Another plus was the fact that we were allowed to store our luggage for 7 hours between when we checked out and headed for the airport to catch our late flight.. Walls between bedroom and bathroom, although glass were frosted up to about 1500 mm from the floor and didn't worry us privacy wise Cons: Bar fridge barely kept anything cool. Only one security card is provided per room which was a little inconvenient on occasions, block out curtains would have helped keep room darker in the mornings, and the tiles in the bathroom were in need of a very good scrub with dirt in the grout and around the shower screen. This was reported to the manager who agreed to look into and address the matter.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised & delighted”
Reviews.Author: famwood
Reviews.Content: I stayed overnight with a colleague.We only needed a bed between flights so were looking for good value for money in a city not known for inexpensive 'quality' accomodation.What a surprise! From the moment we checked in (3am) we received top quality treatment.All of the requests made direct by email had been met, the staff were excellent and the room was one of the cleanest I have seen.Not large but twin single still had pleny of room.Bathroom was spotless with a good selection comp.toilettries, including razor.Be warned there are glass walls so do not stay in a shared room if you are shy!There was plenty of storage and comp. tea & coffee.The breakfast buffet was of good quality and the resteraunt clean.The selection was basic but fresh and would suit most tastes..Bearing in mind the cost we could not fault it. We are both more familiar with the riverfront area of Singapore but once we got our bearings it was not hard to get from the Hotel to the commercial districts.Our suggestion would be to catch a taxi from the hotel to Sim Lim Tower,approx S$5,then enjoy the walk from there, past Sim Lim Square through to Bugis steet markets.Once there you can cross to Bugis Junction for some retail therapy or catch the MRT to anywere in Singapore. This small Hotel made us feel very welcome.It is well managed and maintained and while we were only there for 1 night, would stay again.It would be worth considering for a longer stay if you want to see a great destination at a value price.

Reviews.Title: “During the day fine but didn't get any sleep because of the noise”
Reviews.Author: Ninocka11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one afternoon and night as I had an early exam in Singapore the next morning. As my purpose was to review for the exam and get a good night's sleep, my requirements were a bit specific, and only partially met. First, general comments: The hotel is situated 10 mins walk from the MRT station and there are plenty of local eateries and 7-11s in the streets nearby. The hotel seems renovated, the room decor is nice, modern and practical. There was a kettle with tea and coffee, the fridge (which was not extremely powerful but did work while in the room), the plasma tv with international channels. The bathroom was tiny and the shower didn't allow for much movement, but served its purpose. As others pointed out, the bathroom has a glazed-over glass wall into the room. It looks nice and gives a more spacious feeling to the room but it's maybe not so comfortable if you're not travelling with your partner. The room was clean but the bathroom was not at its squeekiest - a few hairs here and there and some left-over toothpaste in the sink. The wifi worked perfectly and althought I read in some reviews complaints about the unsecure internet, it's standard as in any hotel. The front desk was not overly friendly but did provide me with all the things (iron, wake-up call - 5 minutes early, though, which makes a difference at 6:15am) and information (way to get to another part of town, nearest 7-11) that I needed. I left before breakfast (7am-10am), so I can't judge. Specifics: I finally stayed in a queen room on 6th floor (623). The room was on the top floor at the beginning of the hallway, overlooking the reception and a side street. Very bright in the afternoon light with a window seat that was good for studying. All perfect until the evening when it became apparent that there's no sound-proofing whatsoever. I could hear a machine (aircon?) buzzing outside, cars whooshing down the street (remember, I was facing the side street so I can't imagine what the other side must feel like) and every footstep and word spoken on the corridor. I was on Skype with a friend when he asked what the noise was. It was a baby crying down the corridor! True, it's not the hotel's fault if people were talking loudly in the corridor at midnight or even 3am but that's why insulation is for. I'm not a light sleeper but I woke up several times during the night because of the noise from the hallway. Needless to say, not a good night's sleep at all. Note: I originally booked a single room which had a window overlooking a wall and was the size of a closet (while the bathroom door was open, we could not get out the front door). The one I saw was 301 but I was told all single rooms are the same. As the single room had no natural light to speak of and apart from the bed no place for me to study, they offered a queen room for me (for additional charge of course). Tip: I'm not sure I'd stay again in this hotel. The need to get a rest and sleep through the night is after all not specific just to me and my needs during this trip. I got more sleep staying at one of the hotels on the famously nosy Khao San road in Bangkok, to give you an idea. But if no other option, I'd ask for a back room (facing the wall or the street parallel to the main street) at the end of the hallway away from the elevators and other guests. That might lessen the impact.

Reviews.Title: “ultra modern hotel with reasonable cheap prices”
Reviews.Author: manish98
Reviews.Content: we stayed at aqueen for 2 nights on 27,28 apr 2011.Chech in was quick and receptionalist was genuienly co-operative.We had to carry our luggage ourselves to the room as there were no staff to do that.Thats ok.We take a lift to room no 207.WOW... room was simply awesome,neat and clean,good LCD tv,nice bathroom,cozy bed,ultra-tech button controls,.A complete value for money...free wi-fi was added bonus.Breakfast was ok,not great.Our only issue was the manager at the restaurant...no smile,no welcome,need to tell ur room no. daily to have breakfast.Other things are excellent...complete value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and modern”
Reviews.Author: Nat1972054
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with the cleanliness of the room and how fresh and modern it looked- although I agree with previous reviews in saying the bathroom doesn't offer much privacy! Free wi-fi and bottles of water/tea/coffee etc. Singapore is an expensive city so I thought this hotel offered good value for money. The only downside is the location, its a 10 minute walk to the MRT station which is a number of stops away from the city centre, I would definatly get a taxi to the hotel from the airport (we didn't and it was pretty painful dragging our luggage from the MRT station).

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Laerfu
Reviews.Content: I organized a trip to singapore for 10 relatives and did choose Aqueen Lavender with the hope to find a hotel that is not too expensive but still good enought to let even those fell comfortable who travels the first time to Asia. Everybody was quite content with the hotel. Clean, bathroom with seperated shower, windows that can be opened (even its a bit noisy with opened window at morning rush hour), comfortable beds, free internet, good and friendly service, breakfast buffet as well with varying warm dishes.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and clean.”
Reviews.Author: el-be-es
Reviews.Content: A bit off from central Singapore but the value and public transportation make up for the location. Hotel is very clean, rooms small, good for a couple nights stay but not for a week (was with my girlfriend). 24-hour food court a block away and taxi pick-up upon request at the front desk. Can't speak for the restaurant in the lobby as I didn't eat there, plenty of other food adventures tho awaiting in the city :) Overall a great hotel pick for those on the go or anyone looking to stretch their travel budget the right way.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good in an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: Reevesie9
Reviews.Content: We were generally happy with our stay here, the hotel was clean and the rooms basic but pleasant decor and good value. Other Positives; Decent breakfast, good free wifi service Negatives; A good trek to downtown Singapore if you like to walk everywhere, not a problem if you're taking public transport though. The bathroom walls are glass, so make sure you're comfortable with your roommates habits! Overall we would recommend this hotel and would stay there if we visit Singapore again. It offers good value in a pricey hotel market.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: em0805
Reviews.Content: Don't expect a top 5* service, but the room are clean and the location is good. A really good value for money for short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value Hotel in an expensive City!!”
Reviews.Author: YoungGun
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Aqueen Hotel Lavender in Singapore for a three night vacation before heading onto Thailand. Last visited Singapore in 2003 so I was fully aware of the rise in prices of nearly everything in Singapore. So booking something of good value plus the good reviews via Trip Advisor certainly helped our decision to book the Aqueen Hotel Lavender. Although the Hotel is some distance away from the tourist attractions of Singapore (e.g. Orchard Road, Chinatown and Harbour Front), it is only a 10 minute walk from Lavender MRT which can get you almost anywhere in the City within a couple of minutes. The Hotel was modern and the Rooms were of good size with comfy beds. I note quite a number of reports add the negative of having glass doors and windows surrounding the bathroom. For me personally it didn’t bother me, but my friend and his partner did find this a bit annoying. I couldn’t really fault this Hotel, which included the friendly greetings at reception to the good standard complimentary breakfast buffet that was available each morning. The Hotel also had FREE WiFi, which is always a ‘big’ plus for me when using hotels. Some worthwhile tips if staying at this Hotel is to use the ‘Hawker’ type Food Courts which are located nearby to the Hotel. There you can get an array of authentic / local Singapore food for very few $$$. Plus it’s also a good place to just people watch at night as Singapore comes to life. Overall, if you’re not bothered by a centrally located hotel which has great amenities nearby and is good value for money - then chose the Aqueen Hotel Lavender for your next trip to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Pscoop
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really good value, with lovely rooms and breakfast. The hotel is well placed, near the metro, and in walking distance to little india.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel- but see through bath rooms”
Reviews.Author: ozzietripper
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights. Pros: ' the rooms are compact and clean Free Wireless connection Wonderful buffet breakfast Staff friendly Good Value Cons See through bathroom Its a long way from the closest Mrt and had to catch a bus to get into town We might stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Sleep? What sleep?”
Reviews.Author: DDD999
Reviews.Content: Only needed one night of sleep in Singapore before moving on but what a big mistake this was! My flight arrived at about 1:30am in the morning and it didn't take that long to arrive at Aqueen. The receptionist was very welcoming, friendly and extremely efficient. No complaints here. The room was fairly new, small but compact. For one night of sleep I couldn't have asked for more, or so I thought. The bathroom was small with a little area for shower, an average-sized man would find it difficult to move around in that space. The rest of the room was nicely equipped, a flat-panel television, some tea-making facilities, complimentary water .... and free WiFi inside the room! What a surprise, what a delight! The bed was small but comfy enough so no complaints here until I started to fall asleep. As the room was facing the road - a dual-carriageway, the noise from the road was not only audible but actually quite loud. Even though I usually sleep quite well in hotels, this wasn't one of the nights I want to remember. As morning traffic increased (from 4am onwards), I would wake up with the noise of each passing car. When the trucks or containers passed through, the noise was totally unbearable. When the morning came, I took a look at the windows only to discover that not only were they not double-glazed, the glass was very thin and they were of the sliding type with gaps all round. The complimentary breakfast was served in a little cafe opposite the reception. A buffet type of arrangement with limited choices and the most uninviting smell or taste. The coffee and tea were luke-warm and devoid of any aroma. A little more effort from the management could change so much in this little hotel but I guess having satisfied clients is not on their agenda.

Reviews.Title: “Clean affordable rooms”
Reviews.Author: shazam14
Reviews.Content: The Aqueen lavender hotel is very close from the lavender station (we walked with big luggage and it was fine). The hotel is not in walking distance from Orchard road but you can take the MRT quite easily to and fro. We spent one night at this hotel. The rooms are small but manageable. The rooms are very clean and even smelt clean. This is one of the few hotels in Singapore that is affordable. Staff is very helpful, we left our bags in the locker room as we needed to check out and everything was fine. The breakfast is a bit disappointing but overall the hotel was great.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Frankcanoe
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days in Singapore on our way back from New Zealand. The hotel was quiet, comfortable and reasonable priced. The staff were pleasant and the free breakfast buffet tried to cater for all tastes, no easy job in Singapore. Not far from the metro station and a S$22 fare from the airport. Will stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: nikkifer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aqueen Hotel Lavender post cruise for two nights. We found the service to be great, staff was very friendly and the rooms were clean. The bed was FIRM, and I mean FIRM. The electronics to keep the air conditioning on was a brilliant blue that made it rough to sleep at night. This hotel is located by Little India, and is not the most convenient for sightseeing other touristy areas, but I will say that with a bit of walking (we are in our 40's so it was no problem) you can access the MRT or the hop on hop off bus system. The breakfast was basic. I really think next time we would try to stay somewhere closer to center of town, but really this was a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & efficient hotel for cont'd trip to Malaysia”
Reviews.Author: MagmanSwitzerland
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Aqueen Lavender on Feb 13th to 15th after a long haul flight from Europe. The hotel is about 15min. walking distance from Lavender MRT station which, as other reviews already described, might be a problem when travelling with large luggage. We chose Aqueen MAINLY due to his close location to Lavender st bus station (cont'd trip to Malaysia). Bus station is just in front of the hotel. Room on 6th floor was on the small side but nice and comfortable. We stayed on 6th floor, room on the courtyard was very quite and we slept well. Bathroom included in the room separated by glass door (not so much privacy!) but not a problem for us. Staff were very nice and friendly. Breakfast was ok not so much choice but fine with us. Singapore quick Tips: 1. We would definitely recommend to have dinner at Lavender food Centre located just 2 min. walk from hotel. Soo cheap for a place like Singapore and food is excellent (dinner for 2 incl. drinks = SGD 15). 2. Do not hesitate to hail taxis, they are so cheap compared to European fees, they will drive you everywhere quite quickly! (Lavender to Marina Bay = 4SGD) 3. If you're staying in SIN on Sunday night, walk to Little India and have your dinner there, it's a nice experience! Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeds Expectations-Superb Costumer Care”
Reviews.Author: Shopaholicvamp
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at Aqueen Lavender not knowing what to expect. I chose the hotel based on the tripadvisor recommendation and fellow travellers' reviews, which are mostly positive, except for the comments about the room size. I like checking out different types of accommodations in cities that i visit. The first time we went to Singapore, we stayed at the Ritz, the second time at Shang-ri-la. far from Aqueen in terms of star ratings , I know. But lo and behold, Aqueen impressed us more than the other two!! 1) location wise, it's great, nice quiet part of town, near interesting locales but far from the seedy ones. 2) a block away from the Eminent Hawker Center, where you can find great food at very, very reasonable prices 3) you can easily hail cabs right in front of the hotel (5 to 10 mins to city ), cross the street to the bus stop, or for the more adventurous ones walk to the nearest MRT station (10mins walk away from the hotel) 4) Lobby smells HEAVENLY! the same level of cleanliness extends to the rooms 5) as i mentioned above, VERY CLEAN ROOMS 6) walking distance to convenience stores, a Cheers across the street, and a 711 nearby, 7) Unbeatable Rates by Singapore standards 8) Super nice costumer after-care--left my husbands favorite coat, emailed reception , immediately got a response from Anisah, the Reservation Executive, informing me that they found the item, and are willing to hold it for me until my return :) TRUMPS THE RITZ and the SHANG by 10 STARS :) 9) FREE HIGH-SPEED INTERNET and now for the cons: 1) Breakfast is needs improvement, a little variety perhaps ( Eggs, rice/noodles, 2 kinds of cereals + milk, 2 kinds of fresh fruit juices, 2 kinds of fresh fruits in season, sausages + ham, toast + butter and Jam, hash/ sauteed potatoes EVERYDAY) not bad, but can be better 2) the almost-see thru frosted glass walled bathrooms: Privacy, or the lack thereof, while doing the deed :) I wouldn't mind watching my husband take a shower, but not while he's on the toilet :( 3) too few channels on tv, not an issue for some, but might be for others wanting to take a break from shopping and sight-seeing and just wishing to relax at their room

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel......”
Reviews.Author: ShubhaUchil
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a bit expensive for a budget hotel. We spent 5 nights at this hotel (Room No. 520). The room was small, neat and nice, clean and modern and also well lit. The room has an LCD television (channels are boring), comfortable, cozy althou their bathroom is very very small and lacks privacy and one feels a little stuffy there bathing in hot shower. There is free wireless internet, and the tariff includes breakfast (the spread is not so great). The hotel is about 10 minute walk to the Lavender MRT station and about 5 mins walk to the nearest Bus-Stop. The 24 hrs shopping complex, MUSTAFA is just about a 15 mins cool walk.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money hotel in a city of expensive accomodation”
Reviews.Author: CatmanLondon
Reviews.Content: I spent eight nights at the Aqueen recently and chose the hotel for it's reasonable room rates compared to the hotels downtown in the main touristy areas. The room was on the small side but fine for a solo traveller and the glass partition at the bathroom was not an issue as commented in some reviews. I was allocated a room on the top floor (6th) close to the lift lobby but it was generally quiet at night and I slept undisturbed. The bed was very firm but I like a hard bed and found it very comfortable. The bedroom was in good order, fixtures and furnishing in good condition and it was clean and inviting as was the bathroom. Coffee and teabags weretopped up each day and two bottles of water were also left daily. There was a small fridge to keep this nice and chilled. Breakfast was included with a choice of hot and cold food but it was repetative with the same offerings every day. Not a problem for me as I generally eat a light breakfast or skip it all together. Service was average staff were ok, functional and business like but never went out of their way to make the stay memorable. Location wise the Aqueen is reasonably situated even though it is east of the city centre. Lavender underground station was a six or seven minute walk but Lavender Street is well served by buses and the 145 and 133 service ran direct to the center for a couple of dollars and took about 15/20 minutes. A couple of minutes walk to the next junction is a bus stop for services direct to Orchard Road, Harbour Front for Sentosa Island and Little India. I will definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: ““OVERPRICED FOR BUDGET ACCOMMODATION””
Reviews.Author: OzziesDownunder
Reviews.Content: We make regular trips to Singapore and have our favourite hotels and also sometimes try a different hotel. On our recent visit in January 2011 we had an overnight stay as our early morning flight arrived into Singapore at 2.30am and we had an onward ferry trip so a late check was appealing and our ferry booking time was dependent on confirmation of a late checkout. We chose the Aqueen Lavender as they offered a late check out of 2.00pm, (subject to availability). They were not prepared to commit to the availability until 10.30am on the morning of our departure, despite us emailing them the previous afternoon and asking at check in on arrival at the hotel. The staff are not particularly obliging. We booked a “Standard-Deluxe” room at a cost of S$178.00, it was very small with a badly designed small bathroom, and the bed was very hard. The fridge was an “absorption” style and was not cold. The safe was very small and not bolted down, anyone could easily pick it up and take it away. The free WIFI internet is totally unsecured therefore we were not prepared to check our emails. We did request a quiet room, the other guests on our floor appeared to be a group, and they were very noisy shouting from their rooms along the passageways. The included buffet breakfast was very limited and the breakfast restaurant was busy, the tables are very close together and noisy. Taxi access to the hotel is difficult. It is on a busy main duel carriageway and the street it is on the corner of has “no entry” (one way traffic). We departed the hotel during the morning and on the 3 occasions our taxi had to back around into the one way street and stop right on the intersection. It was dangerous as we were there for several minutes unloading/loading luggage. There is no luggage assistance from the hotel staff, this would help as they should know the difficulty with stopping for taxis. We walked a long way to the closest MRT, which is around 15 minutes - there are plenty of hotels in Singapore with far better access to the MRT. We definitely would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel in expensive city”
Reviews.Author: HattieC
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for one night on our way to Malaysia, and the Aqueen served our purposes...but I wouldn't want to stay for much longer. The staff were not terribly professional or friendly, but service was adequate. The room itself was small and functional, clean and modern. However, there was very little storage and the bathroom lacked privacy. There was free wifi which was welcomed, and the air con was efficient. The next day, the breakfast buffet was fine with a reasonable selection. Checkout was quick. For us the best part about the hotel was that the location served our needs - it is right across the road from the Lavender bus station for buses to Malaysia. There is also a very good hawker centre down the road for cheap, authentic food with few tourists. If you were sightseeing and needed regular access to the MRT, it's a good 10-minute walk, which can be a lot if it's very hot and humid. It's not really close enough in that weather to walk to the main tourist spots but is convenient for Little India etc. In another city, this hotel would seem like poor value for money - but in Singapore, where land is at a premium, and hotels can be vastly overpriced, it represents decent value for money if you don't intend to spend much time in the room.

Reviews.Title: “An adequate budget option”
Reviews.Author: perryw
Reviews.Content: I stayed here just for a night in the middle of July 2010, as my flight arrived at around midnight and I can never quite justify spending for quality accommodation if it’s only for a very short time. I had made the booking directly with the hotel over the phone from another country and the credit card details were required for the confirmation of the reservation. The rate was better for booking through the phone than on the internet. Getting to the hotel was perhaps a little difficult as the taxi driver didn’t know exactly where the hotel was located and also, there wasn’t a proper place for the taxi to stop and allow for the luggage to be unloaded. Instead, the side street was used. The reception was only just acceptable in its approach towards check-in and check-out, it couldn’t be described as being friendly but obviously, a lot of the budget hotels in Singapore are not really just used for accommodation purposes and perhaps that might have to be taken into account in this case because the hotel is located in an area that does appear to be a little seedy. The room was very clean but on the small side. The bed was quite low-lying and a little hard but still offered a reasonable sleep. The soundproofing of the room from the corridor was not a strong point but otherwise, the room seemed to be quiet. My room didn't have the road noise issues mentioned in earlier reviews. The TV was very nice for a budget hotel and the channel selection was ok. The room also came with a safe. The shower was adequate and comfortable but the window pane looking out to the room and the entrance to the bathroom itself was only half-frosted, which could cause potential privacy issues. I liked the wedged mirror design within the bathroom, it offered a multi-angled view. The hotel is located near to a few eateries and also quite a large foodcourt, which seemed to be open even quite late at night because it was about midnight when I arrived at the hotel and the foodcourt was still open. However, the area is probably a little bit red-light in character with some karaoke places. It’s not quite Geylang but seemed a little similar. The nearest MRT station is quite a distance away and that could be a problem if this hotel is meant as an exploration base but taxis shouldn't be much of a problem. The breakfast was included in the rate but it didn’t really offer a huge selection and the food quality was just acceptable. The only things on offer were bread, pastries, chicken ham, omelette, sautéed potato, mee goreng, porridge, fruit juices and coffee and tea. The room rate here seemed a little on the high side, it wasn’t truly in the budget range but I found the hotel quality to be quite good, especially with the room cleanliness and features. However, paying maybe 30-40% more could secure a much larger room in Singapore. I am not totally convinced that the hotel offers value but it was still a highly acceptable stay. NOTE: You can find a video of the hotel room at my youtube hotels page: http://www.youtube.com/AllHotelrooms

Reviews.Title: “Squeaky clean”
Reviews.Author: travelafeme
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about 20 mins from the airport. There are lots of food court and restaurants around. There are also a 7-11 around the corner. Mustafa mall and City square Mall is within walking distance (10 to 15 mins). The nearest MRt is also a 10 minute walk. Our room was small with 2 single beds but very clean and looks new. We had a small ref, kettle and LCD TV. The bathroom has glass walls, not much privacy, but it was okay, since we are all girls. The receptionists were very accommodating. They helped us with directions and they even tell us how much to pay for taxi. Our room also has free wi-fi. I liked their breakfast with a lot of selection, almost the same every day, but that`s okay.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable comfortable hotel with a few quirks”
Reviews.Author: BostonWanderlust
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aqueen Lavender for several nights around the New Year's holiday. The rooms are modern (LCD television, modern furnishings), comfortable, cozy and very affordable for Singapore. There is free wireless internet, free breakfast and the hotel is about a 12 minute walk to the Lavender MRT station which connects to all the major sights and the airport. The hotel is also close to Little India which is a great place to walk around and a food market is a couple blocks away. The hotel does have a few quirks, which may or may not be deal breakers for travelers. The walls in the hotel are a bit thin, so if there are people talking in the hallway, it can be a bit disruptive. Also, the bathroom is separated by a glass door and glass wall, part of which is frosted. This might be an issue if bathroom privacy is an issue for you. Finally, the hotel is next to a casket company so there were a couple of small funeral processions that happened during the day here during our stay. Not disruptive in any way, but a quirk nonetheless. All in all, none of these were major issues and we had a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, especially if you're on a tight budget.”
Reviews.Author: hello_clowee
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel because I took a lot of time poring through reviews here in TripAdvisor. Singapore is notoriously expensive compared to its Asian neighbors, so it was really worth it to go through all the hotels to find the one with a good location without being too expensive. I transferred to Aqueen after staying at Parkroyal. One important tip: don't expect the cab drivers to know the location of the hotel right away. Always have a map in hand, sometimes they are more familiar with the hotels around Aqueen. Check in was quick. I was asked to pay right away, which was no problem. The place was remarkably clean, and its staff was friendly enough. Another tip: for those expecting to have bellboys to assist you with your luggage - this is definitely not your place. You're pretty much on your own, which I actually liked. My room was in one end of the hallway, without much of a view since it was facing another room on another side of the building. I had to draw the curtains often because I could clearly see what the other person is doing in the room opposite of mine, as well as the rooms below him. Halls were also small, two people with luggages would never be able to walk that hall at the same time. My room was a real surprise. I was not expecting much because of the hotel's price range, but they surely do offer standard amenities that top hotels also have. I greatly appreciated the button controls by the door and the nightstand. I also found the room's design a bit smart - they made most out of the space for every room. Since I was alone, there was more than enough room for my things (you can place them by the window). Internet connection was also reliable, and the best part is that it's for free. One issue was the bathroom. I'm very short, and I found the bathroom too tiny. I could not imagine how it would have been like for much bigger backpackers. It would also be difficult if you're sharing the room with someone since there is only a small frosted wall between the shower area and the bedroom. Get another room if you're not comfy with this set up. Another issue is noise. I could clearly hear what people were talking about in the hallway, and sometimes, the room next to mine. I have to say I didn't get quality sleep during my stay. Breakfast - it was surprisingly homey. You just have to get up early to get most out of the breakfast. A major plus was the friendly guests who would gladly share a table with you - although this may not really happen to everyone. Location - just a few minutes' walking distance away from train stations, Little India, and malls. Just keep one thing in mind - don't expect much. You'll appreciate Aqueen Lavender if you don't expect so much of the hotel, trust me. You'll get more than what you paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and cosy”
Reviews.Author: angiechan001
Reviews.Content: Stayed at aqueen over Xmas and it was great. We had a corner room on the top floor (619) and the view was nice. Room was small but adequate. Everthing you need was here: Queen size bed, two bottles of water was provided each day, hair dryer, toileteries, slipppers and wifi. Washroom had a see through glass door. All switches were a push of a button (high tech stuff). They even provide international outlet for electrical plugs. Only thing is that there were litttle tiny ants crawling on the washroom vanity and the mini bar area. They were very tiny and didn't bother us at all. What i like is that there is a 24 hour food stalls just two streets away. There were do much cheap and delicious local food. There's even frog porridge, turtle and crocodile soup! The closest mrt station is Lavender but it's like a 10-15min walk. It's easy to take the bus right outside the hotel (#133 or #145) especially on a hot day. Simply use your ez link card. Reception was wonderful. They even let me borrow tape and scissors to wrap my presents. Breakfast was buffet style and good. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value - Clean & New”
Reviews.Author: wdominic
Reviews.Content: Overall: Clean. New (As of Dec 2010) - utilities, Flat screen TV, shower area, etc Small but cozy cost effective hotel 750 meters to the MRT (Lavender) though still not that far and you can walk it Free WIFI in your room (so convenient!) Improvements Required (in my opinion): Breakfast - plenty of fried food. Would have preferred a healthier option. Summary: I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel not far from the city center”
Reviews.Author: miketri722
Reviews.Content: Check in was a breeze at 10pm on the night of my arrival. I had phoned prior to my arrival to request for my strictly non-smoking room as I am extremely allergic to smoke. My second request for a room tucked in a quiet area, away from street noise. My first request was granted immediately, but due to lack of available rooms, I could only be given a room on the second floor which was on a seldom used side street, which was acceptable. The hotel is very modern and clean. All the standard amenities were available in the room, but the biggest attraction for me was the free breakfast, free in-room wifi & free local calls, including calls to handphones within the city. The room is modern and functional, approximately 20 square meters, which is quite acceptable by Singapore standards. Two drawbacks in the room are the bed which was probably the hardest bed I slept on in a long time. The second being the shower design which left the bathroom floor all wet after taking a shower. Close by ( a block away) s a food court offering a wide array of local fare which is quite delicious and prices are very reasonable. The chicken rice at one of the stalls was a steal at 5 singapore dollars. 7-11 and other convenience stores are available nearby. Unfortunately, I did not get to try the buffet breakfast which came with my reservation, as I had to cut short my stay due to a family emergency. If you're travelling on a budget (I paid approx. US$120/night), I would definitely recommend staying at this hotel. The reviews of other budget chain hotels did not have favorable reviews by other tripadvisor users, so I am glad I decided to book here, rather than save a few dollars at one of the larger chains which has a location nearby.

Reviews.Title: “More than what we expected”
Reviews.Author: ayupermatadewi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Aqueen Hotel Lavender for 3 nights during my vacation in Singapore with my husband. We found this hotel from the online booking, and couldn't get any better rates than this hotel. We both are a trip-advisor minded couple, so we always look at the hotel rating & percentage of recommendation. First we decided to stay closer to Orchard since we would only stay for 3 nights. But then other than Ibis Bencoolen, all other hotels in Orchard vicinity is either super expensive or crappy. During our vacation date, the rate in Ibis is quite expensive, especially if we consider to not spend the whole day in bed. Then we found this Aqueen Hotel Lavender, which rated relatively competitive with Ibis. The price was okay, the best we could get. Honestly reading at the review, we expect a really small room with nothing special about it. But we trully were surprised with everything in it. The design of the hotel is really nice, minimalist with lots of glass elements, and sensory switch lamp, with the new Sharp Aquos TV, and big clean bed. The bathroom was quite small, but with our Asian posture, we fit just fine and have no trouble navigating. Even though there was a see-through section on the shower where you can be seen by people in the bedroom (not suggested for non-family or non-spouse). We had the queen size bedroom, and happy with our room. Breakfast was pretty basic, scrambled egg, sausage, hash brown, cereal, bread, and porridge (there were quite a lot of Asians staying as well when we got there).
