The hotel itself is located at Lavender St. You can take the MRT from Changi Airport & alight directly at MRT Lavender (the green line MRT) in 20 minutes. Young or fit traveller can easily walk from the MRT station to the hotel for about 15-20 minutes (normal walking phase). You can tag along you luggage as the pedestrian area is large. Alternatively you can take the bus or taxi (which can be quite expensive). We can travel easily to Bugis, Harbour Front, and even Clarke Quay as the MRT line connects to those areas as well. Overall, we are happy to stay again at Aqueen Hotel Lavender. Been a pleasant stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Just another Singaporean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JavisMovieCenter
Reviews.Content: I really don't know why everybody gets so excited about Singapore. The hotels usually are overpriced big time and as to how clean the cleanest city in the world is, one might disagree. Aqueen Hotel Lavender is what you would expect of a Hotel in Singapore, though. It is clean, the rooms are cozy, small but nice, and its location is but a short walk from some very interesting places. It is definitely on the better side of the choices you can make.

Reviews.Title: “Stands up to the CLEANLINESS standards of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: wajahatmr
Reviews.Content: Aqueen Lavender is just about what you can expect in Singapore. Clean, serene, charming and elegant. The staff is very respectful, the systems are convenient and there are no surprises attached to the overall experience. The only thing I experienced untoward was the washroom being a glass-walled one, is almost see through which creates an embarrassing feeling for the one using it, and that too without any locks from inside. Moreover, they are not serving Muslim Halal food which is inconvenient for the Muslim visitors. The location is not miles away from Orchard Road and if you are ready to walk from the Lavender MRT station, you will be able to make it in 15 minutes. Overall, thumbs up for Aqueen Lavender!

Reviews.Title: “Standard hotel good value for money”
Reviews.Author: DawneyH
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed at this hotel for 2nights. Overall our stay was good and I would recommend the hotel. It's a little souless but the staff are friendly and helpful the rooms clean and what you see in the pictures. The breakfast was good with a choice of fruit, toast, cereal and cooked food as a buffet. It should be noted the bathroom in the room is a glass partition. Though frosted outlines are still visible, we didn't mind but I get it won't be for everyone taste. The hotel is approx 10 mins walk from Lavender MRT, we found the buses more useful. The 145 takes you through central areas, bugis, chinatown and down to the railway station. If you use the buses make sure you have enough change in coins. There is a great hawker food court 2 mins walk away with an array of different foods. Overall a good hotel and good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, 10-min walk from MRT”
Reviews.Author: k_y_k2002
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 23-28 Oct 2010. The rooms are quite small, but comfortable. Reasonably clean bathrooms and toilets on arrival, but daily housekeeping was not good - they didn't clean the sink area properly, nor did they vacuum (we know this because I saw a small bit of paper dropped on the floor on the first day stay there till the last). Staff are okay, though we had limited interaction with them; not at all obliging in terms of letting us check in early - though this could genuinely be because the hotel seemed to be full. Buffet breakfast was standard, nothing great nor anything bad - the regular spread of toast, butter, jam, sausages and noodles or rice, along with tea, coffee and juice. No egg-station with eggs made-to-order, though they did serve boiled and / or scrambled eggs as part of the buffet. Lavender MRT is a good 10 to 15 minute walk away - might be inconvenient for those who are unable to or do not want to walk the distance. The hotel is situated in a quiet neighbourhood, close to little India. We didn't have any view from our 3rd floor room, which overlooked the roof of the lobby below, and I imagine the other rooms wouldn't have much of a view either. The laundry spoiled my husband's tee-shirt (got it stained), they didn't charge us the laundry costs for the tee when we complained, but no offers to compensate the cost of tee-shirt itself. Overall, not a bad hotel, but not great either. If you're going to be spending a lot of time in the hotel room, I suggest you get a more interesting hotel in a better location. If, like us, you're there only to sleep at night after a long day of sight-seeing, this will suffice.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: dxb625
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel without a printout of our reservation and the front desk could not find our reservation. Sheila called the main office but they could not find our record there as well. She allowed us to check in first, then go get a printout of our reservation at an internet cafe. That was when I realized I made a huge mistake - I made a prepaid reservation for a different hotel through agoda.com. I had no idea why I was so sure I reserved Aqueen Lavender instead of a totally different hotel chain. I even got impatient with Sheila at the front desk but she remained very professional, friendly and helpful. When I went back to Aqueen to explain what happened and expecting to forfeit a night stay, Sheila explained the situation to her manager and they waived the charge. I was in the room for about 10 mins top - room is small but clean, tidy and modern. Would stay there if I am in Singapore again.

Reviews.Title: “value for $ neat tidy rooms”
Reviews.Author: baazi_k
Reviews.Content: I spent 1 night in transit, which was perfect for a good n8 rest. it is a little far from main town area and fairly quite. Rooms have been very well maintained, clean, tidy, all amenities needed. Did not get much scene from my room but for a short stay this does not really matter. Breakfast was really nice with range of options, like most visitors staying have recommended. I would definitely recommend especially for shorter trips instead of longer ones.

Reviews.Title: “nice simple place, good staff and good people”
Reviews.Author: MJMcWhirter
Reviews.Content: I had a good stay here. Nice clean place with friendly staff. Singapore is always easy to get around. A short walk from the hotel takes you through some colorful parts of Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price but be prepared”
Reviews.Author: HappyCampers44
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on tripadvisor we were prepared for a noisy hotel....with very small rooms...... and it really is noisy and the rooms are very small. You can hear people talking in the hallway and also the outside noise.We were on the 2nd floor facing on to a laneway.At night you could hear people talking in the laneway as it was a main entrance to a hostel.Friends stayed on the traffic side and it was not much better. Service from staff was good. Breakfast was good. Not knowing Singapore very well we were worried about getting around but the MRT is just a 10min walk. If you are after a good nights rest then you probably need to book somewhere else.All in All not a bad hotel for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money hotel”
Reviews.Author: radblr
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the F1 at Singapore. Stayed at the Aqueen Lavender Hotel. Just loved the hotel. Small rooms, but spotlessly clean, friendly and helpful staff. Just a ten minute walk to Little India and about a five minute walk from the Lavender Street MRT.

Reviews.Title: “Truly disappointing..”
Reviews.Author: purplemuse
Reviews.Content: I already booked online prior to my stay exactly a day before my scheduled date of arrival to Singapore. I had my reservation printed out and so, when I got there, I just presented it assuming that the check-in procedure will be fast and quick. Apparently, I got disappointed when the lady at the reception double charged my debit card. When I got to my room that's when I studied the bill and yes, they really made a huge mistake. I went downstairs to the reception and the lady kept asking for my card maybe she can retract the payment by swiping it again? No, I didn't let her do that. These things happen and when it does, the cashier never asks for the card back. The woman at the reception area didn't even apologize for the mistake she made. She even mentioned that I signed it, well, I only signed it after she had swiped the card and the damage was already done either way. Also, another thing I have to mention is that I asked for a smoking room but then they gave us a non-smoking room which stank of cigarettes. Really? Is that their standard? If it's a non-smoking room, at least remove the stench of the cigarette!! They say they will return the money within 10 working days. I really hope they do. Location-wise, this hotel is ideal but for the service, there are better and cheaper hotels to stay in. I'm having second thoughts if I would recommend this hotel to any of my friends and colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and new hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Gerakaigera
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel 4 nights (2+2) during our honeymoon is SE Asia. At first we stayed on the 2nd floor with a room facing the inner court. It was very small, but enough for two compact travelers. Very clean, modern and cozy. It was nice to come back after a long day of sightseeing. The second time we stayed on the 6th floor on the room facing the inner court and it was much bigger! So try to get room 621 (if I remember well). The location is very good if you intend to travel by bus to Malaysia - Transnational and Transtar bus terminals are located on the same street. Breakfast was very modest. The only good thing was coffee and toast. Fruit kept running out every morning and they wouldn't refill. Same with milk for cereals. When I asked for a refill, the man told me to pour some from coffee-milk. Breakfast staff was quite rude I must say. Check-in staff also could've been more helpful. We wanted to check in at 10 am after a night bus trip from north Malaysia, sick with fever, but were offered an early check-in for 50% on top of the room rate. Nice touch...Not. Overall, the fact that this hotel is so new and such good condition, I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel next to delicious food court”
Reviews.Author: BCN06
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel during our backpacking trip Malaysia/Singapore. The hotel is modern and nice in a walking distance to the metro station "Lavender" (about 10 Minutes). We had booked a big room, which was perfect, as we had bice large windows with a nice view, a lot of space and a very comfortable bed. Room was spotless clean and very well maintained. Furniture is nice, kind of modern longe-style, flatscreen-TV, small fridge in the room. Bathroom offers "overnight kit" and also two 0.5 bottles of water are provided each day for free in the room. Breakfast is also included in the room rate. We only ate once, but it was ok. More Asian-oriented food- for me it is strange to have fried rice, vegetable or noodle for breakfast, but also toast and jam available. Nice fresh fruit. Best about the hotel is the close location to the "Lavender Food Court", absolutely awsome food, no tourist stuff, lots of locals. I would recommend this hotel, good value for money, modern and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Thumb up Totally”
Reviews.Author: Efleet
Reviews.Content: it's very new, clean room, and nice staff even though we asked the cleaner to clean up some stain in the toilet, and the service was fast and efficient! this is a small incident but from that you can see how people engaged and committed in running a hotel bussiness. LOVE it!

Reviews.Title: “Very good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: mnor
Reviews.Content: This hotel was selected after reading the reviews, and I was not disappointed. The location is 8 minutes from the nearest MRT station - Lavender, which is on the line going from the airport. The hotel is quite new and clean. The reception have no decorations, so it appears a bit sterile. The staff provided good service, and check-in and -out was efficient. For safety must the room card be used to activate the elevator. The rooms are small, but well designed with smart solutions for stowage of personal belongings. The bathroom has a smart layout, but why is the toilet paper dispenser behind me when I need it? I slept very well. Noise from air conditioner and traffic outside was low. However, the bed was a bit short for me (1,8 m).

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Sarah1981Surrey
Reviews.Content: Booked to stay for 2 nights after reading trip advisors reviews. Great value for money, clean rooms with all the facilities you need. As others have mentioned the Lavender foodcourt round the corner is good for meals and the MRT is within a 10min walk. The hotel is within easy walking distance of the Arab quarter and little india which were interesting to explore. I see what people mean about the frosted glass wall for the bathroom, leaves little to the imagination! Didn't bother us though. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: guneingdoe
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, new and tidy. Although it was quite small (you can barely turn your body when in the shower), it has all the basic amenities- TV, coffee maker, big beds. The hotel location is a 15-min walk from the nearest MRT station, Lavender. To some Asians, the fact that it is situated next to the Singapore Casket might bring some worry- but for me it was OK. Staff (esp the housekeeping) was nice, speak fluent English and was quite helpful. There is a large food centre at the back of the hotel where you could find cuisines from around the world. But the centre has no air-con which means you can get quite sweaty when eating there.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed”
Reviews.Author: iamintampa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a good value, but you MUST be aware of some things before you make a booking. 1) The hotel rooms are VERY small and the bathroom has NO solid walls that face into the room - only glass that is partially frosted but far, very far, from private. Think twice about sharing a room with someone unless you're traveling with very close friends, a spouse, or someone you've dated a long time. 2) My partner and I both had small bites on our bodies that match the patterns of bed bug bites. This happened even after we requested a change of linens. We won't stay here again because of this issue. 3) The hotel is about 10 minutes from two different MRT stops. Which stop you walk to depends on where you destination is, as one of the two lines is the "red" line and the other "green" line. If you come on the MRT from the airport take the green line to Lavendar and walk from there. Google maps, or an Android or iPhone can help navigate you from the MRT. 4) There are windows which are good for light, but they mostly face the interior of a U-shaped structure that forms most of the hotel's design and offer no view. At best you can determine if its raining out. 5) The hallways are loud and even people talking normally can be heard in the rooms. 6) Our electronic key stopped functioning twice during our visit requiring reprogramming at the front desk. 7) On arrival we were given our electronic key and room only to find on entry to that room that it was the room and a duplicate of the secure key to the couple who had just checked in before us. This was quite embarrassing to all involved. Goods: 1) Modern hotel and a good value for the money. 2) The breakfast is good and a nice value included in the hotel's price. 3) Electronic pass keys for the door and electronic controls for the lights and air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: hchrisau
Reviews.Content: Friendly, efficient staff. Reasonable price. Comfortable beds. Modern rooms. Decent LCD TV. Free breakfast. But no bath tub. The rooms are quite small. The bathroom is surrounded by obscured glass. Nice place for couples... not so nice with kids or non-family members.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good.... and I'm very hard to please!”
Reviews.Author: RachSydney2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night on a stopover. Check in fast and efficient. Reception staff not particularly friendly but very helpful if you ask questions. Yes rooms are on the small side, but there is plenty of bench space for 2 peoples luggage and more. Room very clean (and I am obsessive about cleanliness, so that says something) as is the linen, but towels are hardly what you would call fluffy. Free wifi throughout the hotel and connection is very fast. Nice big flat screen tv with good international channels. Touch sensitive lights are a good addition. Room very well lit with a full length mirror (very important when you want to try on your shopping purchases!). Bathroom pretty clean except for mouldy wall by the shower which was pretty gross but not a deal breaker. Bathroom had all the amenities. Yes the bathroom is separated from the bedroom with frosted glass and if this really bothers you book somewhere else. Yes walls are also paper thin. The house keeping girls, while very friendly, would conduct very loud conversations with each other across rooms which was a little bit annoying. Location was pretty good. Can flag a taxi down from right out the door the minute you step outside anytime of the day or night. It's about a SGD8 taxi ride to Orchard Road or Clarke Quay. I didn't walk to the MRT so can't comment on that. I had an early flight to catch the next morning so didn't get to try the food either. All in all, I would definitely stay here again on a short stop over type of stay but once the wear and tear of this fairly new hotel starts showing it may be another story!

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a few days in Singapore if your budget is limited”
Reviews.Author: sebhoff
Reviews.Content: OK - it's not the Raffles. But it has everything that's needed, including a fridge, a hair dryer, free wifi and a safe. Rooms are fairly small but practical. As others have said, the location is OK, but not ideal. There's great food nearby - 24 hours a day. You need to settle the bill when you check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: chocolatebb_10
Reviews.Content: Good location, about 20 mins from airport..(By taxi), food court and 7-11nearby, small room, but Have Free WIFI! not much choice for breakfast. BUT not bad for just short stay

Reviews.Title: “cheap and great”
Reviews.Author: SaraK14
Reviews.Content: room was small but very clean and it was enough for 2 ppl who just want to see the city. great food court was very close. 10 minutes MRT to the city centre. even got free breakfast! staff was very friendly and understanding

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: TravelinMan50
Reviews.Content: Pro's: The rooms was ample size for two adults traveling (twin beds). I like how the bathroom was enclosed and the shower was seperated enough that nothing else got wet. Like many hotels, you need to put your room card in a slot/holder to activate the room's electricity and air conditioning. When we entered the room it might have been a little musty, but any oder immediately leaves once the AC is turned on. So, if you're looking for a room that's clean and has basic amenities this is it. Con's If you need or want any travel or tourist advice- you'll be dissapointed. They are efficient, but not friendly, very business like. Also, the walk to the MRT is about 10 minutes. It's not too far, but it's not close either. Average- the breakfast buffet is very average/skimpy. But it is convenient to eat right at the hotel. The TV has a limited number of English stations, but this is not a resort/business hotel. It's for the traveler that really only needs a good clean room for a place to sleep. It certainly met my expecations and would stay there again- over the hotel Value Thompson, just because the room layout is better and you get breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good value if you don't mind a walk to MRT”
Reviews.Author: koalagirlPerth
Reviews.Content: Based on the reviews here I booked this no frills hotel and was gald I did. It isn't fancy - it is simple, clean and good value. It is perfect for someone who wont be spending a lot time at the hotel - just get up, enjoy the simple breakfast included (toast, juice, tea, cofee, bake beans, egg dish, rice, noodles...) and then get out there and explore and return exhausted to the hotel to a very clean, small room with a comfy bed and late night TV (but there are very few channels to choose from). The only practical down side is when someone needs to use the toilet for 'serious business' and there is not enough privacy offered - sure the glass is frosted but... shower and bathroom fine, but would prefer the toilet to have solid walls. At a fast walk it took me 10 - 12 mins to the Lavender MRT station and that is using the short cut via the back streets as listed on someone else's review. A huge assest to this hotel is the Lavender food court, open 24 hours in the next street - lots of choice and clean setting. At 6.30am it cost me $14.90 to terminal 1 at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rabcat4u
Reviews.Content: This is a modern clean hotel. The neighbourhood is good but the hotel is 10 to 15 minutes walk to mrt station. On a hot day that can be a long walk. But this is a good value hotel for Singapore. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, and great value - just don't expect a lot of space!”
Reviews.Author: fugu_master
Reviews.Content: We actually booked 2 rooms since the family room they had was facing the road and noisier, whereas if you get a room facing the rear alley it is much quieter. The hotel is located next to a funeral parlour - did not bother us, but there is a procession in the back alley every couple of days for about 20 mins. On the plus side, Lavender Food Centre is <200m away, there's a 7-11 nearby and bus stops are outside. MRT takes about 10 mins to walk to tho but you can catch a bus if you want to. Overall the Aqueen Lavender was tremendous value considering you are getting a modern clean hotel in a reasonably central location. Friendly staff but don't expect lots of space but certainly comfortable enough.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money - Recommended”
Reviews.Author: HelenaDubai
Reviews.Content: We were really pleased that we chose this hotel. Its very new and modern inside and very clean, (it can perhaps feel a bit clinical). Being so close to the MRT was great and meant we could travel around cheaply and easily for the whole trip. The Lavender food court was great and really cheap. Breakfast at the hotel was pretty good. If you are looking for somewhere that is reasonable in price but still allows you to see Singapore (with a small amount of travel) then this is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Trendyt Value”
Reviews.Author: Riz469
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a trendy hotel in Singapore booked directly with the Hotel. about 110 $ rooms are compact , touch switches, Glass bathroom, helpful staff right advice on how to reach Bird park & Airport thru MRT close to 3 MRT station about 10 min walk

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, clean and new hotel”
Reviews.Author: apananth
Reviews.Content: I tend to deviate a bit from others that stayed in this hotel, particularly in location. Being in Singapore, you don't want to keep sitting in the hotel room and all that you need is a peaceful sleep after a tiring day of roaming around, shopping and sight seeing. Rooms were well appointed with all the basic facilities you need when on the move. Tea/coffee making facilities, a basic buffet breakfast (good enough to start a day) make it a deal. If you are on a budget, this is the place to stay. Rooms were clean and the staff very courteous. 10 mins walk to Little India and the famous Mustafa Shopping Centre. Ideal place of stay for Indian. For the health conscious, have a heavy meal in any of the restaurants in Little India and walk to burn out. One aspect the hotel management should consider is to seal the bathroom doors. The room where I stayed had glass doors with the sealing worn out. In all, value for money. If you need more amenities, go out to other places and shell those extra bucks for services that you rarely use.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget hotel but a little isolated”
Reviews.Author: yaleen
Reviews.Content: Me and a friend stayed at this hotel for 5 days in June, 10. We chose this hotel by looking at reviews on tripadvisor itself. The hotel lived up to our expectations. Pros:- - Very clean and new hotel. - Good staff - Decent breakfast - Good rates Cons:- - Bit far from MRT, > 10 min to Lavender street MRT and abt 15 min to Farrer Park. - Small room, with very small bathroom - transperant bathroom walls - thin walls, could hear everything from other rooms Overall, it was a good experience for us. Since I had travelled with a friend, we had no problems in walking the 10-15 min to the MRT stations. It is also close to the Lavender street foodcourt which serves good local cuisine. One recommendation to the visitors, especially from India, would be to carry an universal adapter as the hotel has Singapore type plug points which would not fit for chargers and laptops, etc. I would recommend this hotel if you are willing to walk a bit. Otherwise there are hotels at better locations near little India for similar rates.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms and good location”
Reviews.Author: AusiTraveller
Reviews.Content: We (couple) stayed at Aqueen hotel Lavender for 6 nights at the beginning of June 2010. The hotel is almost new and rooms are modern and very clean (they were cleaned every day by room service). The hotel personal are friendly and professional. Rooms are not big but enough to accommodate two people if you are not spending whole day & night in the room (I assume you are not visiting a city/country just to stay in the hotel room, day and night!). Aircon was quite and almost without a noise but was sometimes difficult to adjust the temperature. Hotel location is great. There are 3 MRT stations (Lavender, Farrer Park or Boon Keng) close to the hotel (approx 10 minutes walk to any of them using the shortest connection roads). Bus halts are almost opposite of the hotel (Lavender Road). Reasonable room rate (Singapore hotel room rates are rising!), Free WiFi, free water bottles (2 per day), 32 inch LCD TV and the room itself makes your stay much comfortable. The bathroom was separated with frosted glass but it was not a problem for us at all. As Singapore is not a place to worry about food you really don't need to use the coffee shop at the ground floor. But if you just want to have your breakfast as the first thing in the morning before you hit the road then the best option is to have breakfast in this cafe. If you are a hotel guest, the price for the breakfast buffet is very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Good and easy to improve”
Reviews.Author: Benchmarker
Reviews.Content: Good hotel with a reasonable rate and once you are familiar with the location you enjoy it even more. The food court recommended by the staff just 200 m away is great to enjoy all kinds of local specialties !!!! Positive: nice clean rooms, very good preconditioning, efficient staff, good eco/green program for towels and sheets. To improve: Here and there maintenance issues that could be fixed easily (around emergency signs, carpet under the bed was loose, mirror in the bathroom very damped when taking a shower, etc....). If you want to explore the area and are not afraid to walk a bit, go to the Indian and Arab quarters, it is like going to another country...

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: lintang
Reviews.Content: This is a no-fuss hotel (no room service, no concierge etc) but clean and adequate. A good choice for a business traveller but not for tourist.

Reviews.Title: “a great Budget Hotel that doesn't appear to be one”
Reviews.Author: EurasiaVoyager
Reviews.Content: Over the years, I have been staying in Singapore in virtually all hotel categories, from 4,5stars to 1-star. this very new hotel here is one of the best if not the best value for money I had there, considering that SG is the most expensive place in South-East-Asia and will always be. The rooms are small, but not tiny, unlike in other budget hotels in Hong Kong, SG or Malaysia I have been staying before it was easily possible to walk around the bed (I had a Queensize-bed which was a little on the small side, though), the room had all amenities that you may need and probably not expect in a budget-joint: a Cupboard, not just a hook on the wall as in other cheapo-places, water heater and complimentary coffee/tea-making-facilities, free slippers, a safe, free WiFi ( a good, stable connection as is common in SG), two bottles of water per day. the bathroom is small too, but it has all the usual amenities. as some other members here, I really HATE those glass-walls many new hotels have nowadays, but there is a curtain and the glass has an adhesive foil attached, it appears to be frosted glass, so it did not bother me at all. the aircon is strong and makes the room VERY cold, too cold for my taste and I somehow were not able to adjust it. the location is not as bad as it first seems, the Lavender MRT-station is less far away than I thought (though with a lot of luggage and considering the sometimes oppressive humidity of SG you may rather opt for a cab or the Minivan-Shuttle for SG$ 9 from the airport on your arrival). plenty of excellent Cheapo-food places around, the fantastic Lavender-foodcourt is just a stonethrow away, as are several minimarkets plus - for those who r into a different kind of entertainment - several dodgy karaoke joints (but far enough so no need to worry about that). Lavender Bus station is just opposite, so even your onward-journey is a breeze, considering you leave by Bus for Malaysia or maybe even Thailand. Very convenient ! Well ok, it was not THAT 100% perfect: the hotel is located on a very busy road, and even I got a room NOT facing the street as I requested, there was still quite some noise to be heard until very late. I don't wanna know how noisy those rooms facing the main road are. the coffeeshop on the ground-floor does not seem to offer a wide menu and the prices are not very competitive. considering the proximity of the several foodcourts and eateries, it was no wonder I never saw any patrons in there during my 2 days stay. on the day I checked out I asked them if I can have a late check-out, as my flight departed in the early evening, but they were not willing to give me even just 1 hour ! they said "sorry we are fully booked today", but that's lame ! The house-keeping staff can not make up all the rooms at the same time and not 100% of the new guests do not check in exactly at 2 pm ! But nevertheless, I would recommend this place to others who don't wanna spend too much in SG on accom. the prices seem to rise quickly, though. I know when the hotel opened just months ago or so, the rate was below 100 SG$ (maybe an introduction-rate). I paid 108, and I checked the rates just yesterday again, as I have to go to SG again very soon, and now it is already 118 SG$. Not sooooo competitive anymore. but still worth the few Bucks more, compared to other budget options in SG like those Hotel81's, Fragrance's or Value-Hotels. those are often more or less brothels, where the Aqueen definitely is not (thanks god!). If me or you can not afford to stay in such a hotel in the future, it would probably be a better idea to stay away from SG entirely. but this one is perfectly acceptable.....

Reviews.Title: “Good value but not for more than 1 person”
Reviews.Author: yashin1974
Reviews.Content: A good new hotel - basic, cheap and clean. BUT............. One big draw back. The bedroom and bathroom do not have a wall separating them but glass top to bottom. Pretty strange hah.... It is sort of frosted to halfway (pretty see through) -the toilet is right next to the glass and you can see everything when someone is in the shower. The bathroom door is like a shower door with gaps all around. Problem?? Want to see and hear someone sat at the toilet? Want to see everything while they shower? Little or no privacy in otherwords. So, ok if you are alone but i don't recommend it with your partner or even worse a friend.....don't really want to be lay on the bed and see them sat on the toilet!! Location is ok but not great. Taxi costs between S$6-8 dollars to Orchard Rd. MRT (metro) station is a good 10min walk away and not great in the singapore sun. Is woule be nice to shop and be close to the hotel-but it was easy to get a taxi back and it only takes about 10mins. Hotel is fine. I am suprised they spent the money on the lift swipe , door swipe system and touch sensitive light switches but did not give more privacy in the bathroom. Maybe a wall would have taken up more space? Bed was hard and gave me backache but i liked the fact it had tv, some space and was quiet. I felt safe it was safe with new swipe card system and the staff were efficient. There is no breakfast but a little cafe joined. Better to grab a taxi and eat breakfast elsewhere. Would i stay here again.....umm if alone and not too fussed about being close to the shopping area-yes! At approx S$ 100 a night it is HALF of my preferred budget hotel (Ibis on Bencoolen- better location-no need for taxis) If a couple, friends sharing and you dont want to see them sat at the toilet or in the shower then book elsewhere. (god help you if you have upset stomach and have to sit there for a while!!!)

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: coffeeaddictAuckland
Reviews.Content: The Aqueen Hotel is new so everything was fresh. I thought the value was excellent for the quality of the hotel. The rooms are very small but mine was more than adequate. The staff were very friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. Great wireless internet too. I knew before booking that the closest MRT was about 10 minutes walk and its a very efficient way to get into the city or other parts of Singapore. The problem I had with this hotel was that there is just not much around it. Sure there are small "market style" eating places, but not much else for tourists. For this reason, although I really enjoyed my stay here, I may not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: rehanhaque
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Aqueen Lavender for a night, and lamented the fact that had spent the first 3 nights of the trip at another hotel at double the cost. Anyway, my original stay in Singapore was for 3 days and I initially stayed at IBIS Singapore on Bencoolen. I had to extend the trip by a day, but due to the valcanic ash, IBIS increased the room rate by about SGD100, which I was not willing to pay. So I spent the 4th night at Aqueen Lavender. It was an excellent decision. This is the best value for money I have ever gotten in any hotel in Singapore. For a total of SGD108, it was a great deal. A little hard to find, but the check in was smooth and I loved the structure of the room, a standard type. Negatives: 1) My room was on the side of Lavender street and it was a bit noisy at night. 2) The 'Wi-fi internet' didn't work. 3) Shower area was a bit too tight. Other than that, I would definitely recommend this budget hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good for the price”
Reviews.Author: amd_34
Reviews.Content: Singapore hotels have gotten expensive the past couple of years so this new hotel is good value compared to many at a similar price. You get a reasonably sized, clean modern room with all modern amenities. While it's on a main road I didn't find any trouble sleeping soundly. It's a good ten minute walk to the nearest MRT (Lavender) but I frequently used the slightly more distant Farrer MRT as it's close to Mustafa and a brand new new mall that connects directly to the MRT. Staff are quite friendly although if you expect full on concierge service then this might not be the place for you. Lavender Food Court is a 2 minute walk with lots to choose from. There are also several mini-marts near by. If you want something a little more central and closer to an MRT station then South East Asia Hotel near Bugis is a similar price with larger rooms but it's an older hotel. If you want something newer and don't mind a bit of a walk then Aqueen is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Oh dear - if you normally stay in hostels, you'll think this is fab. Otherwise - don't bother”
Reviews.Author: Jellyblush
Reviews.Content: Well, I was excited to stay at this hotel after reading all the positive reviews. I was in Singapore just 2 nights, and chose this hotel based on reviews on here, the free wifi, plus it was on the airport side of the city. There are a few positives - it's near the fantastic Lavender hawker centre, and the complimentary water is a nice touch. It is also very clean & the wifi is great. But the negatives..... wow. Well, firstly, after paying taxes, it is not that cheap. If you check out sites like wotif.com or hotelclub.com, and book in advance, you can stay at a 3.5 or 4 star in the financial district for only 10 - 15 more per night - if you can afford the little bit extra DO IT! I don't really consider this to be a hotel - they have no guest services, they were very unhelpful and rude when I requested little things (adapter and bottle opener) - they rudely told me they don't provide extras, although they have a tiny bar so I should have been able to at least get use of a bottle opener. The floor is concrete, and feels like it. The bed is also concrete. I can't overstate how hard and uncomfortable it was - like sleeping on the floor. I asked for the quietest possible room and was assured I had been given it, but the traffic noise was incredibly loud and still kept me awake through my earplugs. There is also a lot of noise from the corridor and other rooms, as others have mentioned. The bathroom is tiny and there is a little hidden step which I stubbed my toe on - it bled, I asked for a plaster, no, of course I couldn't have one even though the hotel was the reason I was bleeding! Unless you are really, really strapped for cash and can't afford 10 - 20 bucks for something better, don't stay here. It is more akin to a hostel in terms of comfort than a hotel. Noisly, unfriendly and uncomfortable. But nice work on the wifi & cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “FUN-tastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: lakwatsera2274
Reviews.Content: Loved this Hotel very clean and staff were friendly. Value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: RamsdenFoots
Reviews.Content: We booked the Lavender hotel for our return stopover in Singapore for 2 nights. We arrived at the hotel quite late around 10.30pm, we decided to get the MRT from the airport so we got off at Lavender station and walked to the hotel which was about a 10 minute walk this was not much fun due to our heavy bags. However when we arrived at the hotel the staff were very friendly and checked us in. We had a standard double room on the 6th floor, on entering the room it was very clean but basic it reminded me of an Ibis hotel it was the same kind of design, there was a fridge in the room but nothing inside. We were provided with complimentary bottled water and toiletries. The rooms do not have double glazing so it could be quite noisy at times, also during our second night there was a lot of shouting in the corridor which was disturbing. The bed was also very small & not very comfy. I think the hotel rooms are more suited to couples or single people due to them being quite small and also the bathroom is a little see through as it is a glass window and door with a frosted glass line around the middle, so you can sort of see in the bathroom. The location of the hotel isn't too bad considering the price, we were getting taxis into the centre of Singapore because taxis in Singapore are very cheap, it was 8 Singapore dollars from the hotel to Orchard Road, and 18 SD to the airport. The MRT station is about a 10 minute walk from the hotel. Overall the price of this hotel is very good for Singapore and I would probably stay here again just because of that.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: carrowsmith
Reviews.Content: Very modern, clean and friendly place. I'd love to stay here again next time I'm in Singapore. It's perhaps not the best location in Singapore but not far from Little India, 10 minutes walk to Lavender MRT station isn't that bad and means its quiet. The staff were so friendly and allowed me to leave my case there while I spent a weekend in Kuala Lumpur even though I wasn't checking in for another 3 days, they also told me about local places to go. Very pleased and I'd recommend this hotel for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellente”
Reviews.Author: SCandCS
Reviews.Content: It was a nice place to just chill and relax for a small price. (Not for that romantic evening though). Helpful and friendly staff. Clean. Even the lobby smell nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good! Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Downsouthaddict
Reviews.Content: Good hotel! good location from the food court , Lavendar. The rooms are very small but its clean! Bathroom was small but nice. clean towels and linen everyday which was great!

Reviews.Title: “Everything but frills and prime location”
Reviews.Author: nworbd
Reviews.Content: Hotel prices have gone sky high in the island city-state; the Aqueen Lavender stands out as a bargain. We got a corner room for just under $100 US per nite, stayed three nites whilst my wife attended a professional workshop. The hotel was well laid out, very clean (the hotel's only a few months old) but not fancy. Free wi-fi, nice bath, comfortable bed. It's a 10 minute walk to the MRT, but there are buses on nearby Jalan Besar. Several good food courts immediately nearby, but not much else. Little India (a must see; great food!) is about 15 minutes distant on foot. The hotel restaurant is OK for breakfast. Staff were unfailingly helpful and cheerful. We'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “" Great value..."”
Reviews.Author: OgyJakarta
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a night, the room is small, but new room and very clean and have everything you need ( safety box, soap, clean towel, etc), there is circle K near the hotel and a food court, too. Although, it is far from MTR station ( 15 minutes ) but we can consider to use a bus, there is bus stop near the hotel, we can take a bus to orchard, harbour front , etc, we only need to ask the information to the nice front desk staff....

Reviews.Title: “It's a real value for money”
Reviews.Author: boonnah
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel through TripAdvisor. I stayed there for 2 nights and found out that the reviews I read online were accurate. The hotel is relatively new, providing guests with sleek and modern-design rooms. The room is not too big but somehow quite cozy, with LCD TV. Coffee-making facilities are provided. The wifi is working great. The staff is very helpful. Downstairs in the lobby, there is a small cafe serving delicious Boston mussels. The hotel doesn't provide breakfast, but don't worry, there are numerous food courts around the hotel. if you're up for Chinese food, there is a food court just one block from the hotel. But if you prefer moslem food or thai food, just walk a bit further toward Mustafa center, before reaching Mustafa, there would be a food court on your right serving great and cheap Tom Yam Goong (Spicy Thai seafood soup). If there is a little drawback, it's the location. It takes about 10 minutes walking from the nearest MRT station (Lavender), and it could be quite annoying when you've got to do it in the middle of a sunny day :). However, if you want to take the cab, the hotel janitor would gladly help you to find one (it takes less than SGD 10 to go to Orchard). Or, if you prefer the bus, the bus stop is just about 50 m away. It takes about 20 minute bus-ride to the Esplanade. My advice is, stay here if you want to spend your days sightseeing around Singapore, and return to the hotel in the evening, so the hotel is mainly your place to take a rest. Due to its location, it's not practical to stay in this hotel if you need to go back and forth, unless your business is nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: veenquin
Reviews.Content: This place exceeded my expectation. Modern interior, comfortable bed, convenient location and value for money (98bucks).. Would definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “the place is great, the lounge is fantastic, great live music and superd singing”
Reviews.Author: newmoonSingapore
Reviews.Content: my experience in Aqueen was really cool. The service staffs were attentive and well mannered. The breakfast really nice and cheap, Like SG$4 for a breakfast set, quick cool. The Prawn noodles is really nice. I brought my girlfriend there for an evening of nice music and i got. The singer... young pretty girl, but really sweet voice. she sang really good. They have a full bar too. Barnaidsreally cool. I had a few glasses of wine before i try some fresh oysters, i love it. I would reccomend the oyster shots and the prawn noodle. I must say that the sound system is great and we smoke at the alfesco... what else to ask for in a SG$98/night hotel..

Reviews.Title: “I couldn't believe how nice this hotel was for the price”
Reviews.Author: Sue789_9
Reviews.Content: We paid $66 Singapore a night for a twin room and stayed for 5 nights. The room was immaculately clean, well designed, really good air-conditioning, free water, all toiletries and slippers. The hotel staff weren't very friendly when we checked in, but when a friend was trying to get in contact with us they were very helpful and left several notes in our room with messages. The location is what you'd expect for such a cheap hotel - about 10-15 minutes walk from the nearest Metro station although there is a bus station a couple of minutes walk away which we used quite a few times. There is budget food available in the nearby Lavender Food Court.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Bl00dSucker
Reviews.Content: Tried my luck and had booked this hotel as it is always full, with a reasonable rates which was an affordable and worth in Singapore. Me and my boyfriend was amazed of the modern design of their room, clean and neat, provides all the facilities you needed especially complimentary internet and local phone calls. Reception counter opens 24hrs. Helpful staffs, always greet us with a smile whenever we walk by. During our check in, they took a very short while to check us in. Had short conversations with their managers, both are kind and helpful. I would recommend young couple to try this hotel. Good location where you can easily grab some foods and transportation are very convenient too, all within 10-15mins. The only thing that upset me was when I was in the room; my boyfriend had gone to 7-11 to get some milk. When he came back, he went to the lounge to have a quick glance but what surprised him was, a man came to him and had a conversation with him and started to offer if my boyfriend wants a room, can get his help. The worst part is he even hinted my boyfriend that he can have some "fun" and drinks and will be accompanied by young girls in the lounge too. For the period of night time, the lounge was very noisy as the window was not really sound proof and what irritates us a lot was the bad singing from the girl. During morning, we were waked up by the housekeeping who talks so loud outside our room. Suggest that they look into this matter as night we can’t sleep well, and morning we was woke up by the loud voices outside our room. During check out time, it does not took us long to wait in the reception as we had done all the payment when we checked in. Last but not least, overall the hotel room is nice and good service from the front line. I and my boyfriend decided to come back again, probably in another 2mths time.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Voypor
Reviews.Content: I'm just after leaving Singapore, and my girlfriend and I loved this hotel, the room was small but what more do you need for the price. Bathroom is a grand size with more than enough room to do what is neccesary. The staff are so polite and can't do enough for you. The hotel is new and looks and feels better than anything around this location, budget traveller this is ideal as all transport is outside the door nothing more than ten minutes. I'd come back and thinking of asking for a loyalty card

Reviews.Title: “Small room but convenient, affordable & had everything we needed”
Reviews.Author: Scar604
Reviews.Content: As many reviews have mentioned, the rooms are quite small, but I think that's generally the case in Singapore, especially if you're looking for a mid-range budget hotel. Relative to other parts of southeast Asia, it is more expensive to live in/visit Singapore and accomodations are more expensive so at 75 SGD per night, this hotel is budget for Singapore and pretty good value. Despite being small, the rooms are modern, impecabbly clean, and have everything you need - including coffee/tea making facilities, a mini fridge, a desk, free decent wi-fi, and a big flat screen tv with a few good English channels to choose from. As mentioned, the bathroom is made of frosted glass so privacy is a bit limited in that respect and there is only half a glass wall seperating the shower from the rest of the small bathroom so the whole bathroom does tend to get a bit wet when you shower. My husband and I accidentally booked a twin room instead of a double, but the cleaning lady immediately helped us put the two beds together and they fit together nicely to form a double bed. Unlike a previous reviewer, our reservation clearly stated that taxes/service charge was on top of the room rate so there were no surprises there. If you're a bit of a night owl, the hotel has the perfect location - there's a number of bars nearby, but they're far enough that you can't hear noise from them when you're in your room. There's also plenty of 24 hour convenience stores and late night food choices nearby, as well as the 24 hour Mustafa center about 10 min walk away where you can get anything from appliances to jewlery to groceries anytime of the day! The lavender food court on the next street over offers a huge array of good food choices at fair prices and many stalls stay open late. As mentioned, no breakfast is included but plenty of places to eat cheap nearby. It's about a 10 min walk to the metro/subway. If you're feeling lazy or carrying heavy luggage when arriving you can grab a cab from the metro station to the hotel for just $3 SGD. Singapore has a very modern and efficient subway system so we found the location of the hotel great for exploring. The only problem with the subway is you have to wait in line to refund your stupid subway card to get $1 refund each time! My only complaint about the hotel is that at checkout, we had to already paid but had to wait while they sent someone up to our room to do God knows what since there was no mini bar to check over. The checkout process could be more efficient.

Reviews.Title: “small but very nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: FluffyTiger
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few days and liked the small but nice and clean rooms. Compared to other hotels in Singapore the price is fair and the quality is very good. Wifi in the rooms works perfectly. Hotel is situated a ten minutes walk from the MRT but busstops for busses to the citycentre are only a few minutes away. Lavender Hawker Centre is also a two minutes walk and has a nice selection of food.

Reviews.Title: “Payment scam”
Reviews.Author: PAandLI
Reviews.Content: The owner is dishonest about the amount that he charges. At the reservation he mentions that the amount at the reservation is TOTAL cost. When you check out he charges you 7% GST and 10% service extra. We were pissed off at the desk and he mentioned us that this was was stated in the fine print . First all why do you have fine print and second the word "total" in the reservation is a lie because it is not a total.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rickydmd888
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Aqueen@Lavender Hotel last Feb 1-4, 2010. Since it is a relatively new hotel, we availed of their promo rate (Sing$78/night nett). We were not disappointed. Although the room was small, it was clean and came with all the extras (flat screen TV, ref, complimentary bottled water and tea/coffee making gadgets, disposable slippers, toiletries). There is no complimentary breakfast, but one block away is the Lavender Hawker's Place where you can get cheap food. There is FREE wifi inside the room. The MRT station may be a bit of a walk (especially with the hot weather). But outside the hotel is a bus stop. My only concern was the bathroom. There is no shower curtain (although there is a curtain rod in place). So the whole bathroom gets wet after taking a shower!

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfect”
Reviews.Author: janetea
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights and liked it very much. Room is very small but has everything you need - TV, complimentary water, fridge, shower hairdryer, shampoos etc. Very clean and new. It is not far to walk to Lavender station - say 10 mins. The only downside was that there is a local (tiny) incinerator opposite so we had to turn the a/c off until it stopped smokinh (30 mins). Restaruants not far. By far the most reasonably priced hotel we found on the net. Beware if you use a taxi , as it is new, they may not know where it is so make sure you know the street name and roughly where it is. We got a cab from Lavender Stn as it was raining stair rods but the driver did not know the name of the side street on which it stands.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL WITH SMALL PRICE”
Reviews.Author: beansandgert
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for just one night with my 6 month old baby and husband. We chose the two single beds as I knew from reading reviews and looking at their site that only a queen bed was the other option (not big enough for the three of us). Yes, the rooms were smaller by most standards but the quality was high! Great little bathroom with glass walls and easy on/off light switches bed side. The pillows were great but the beds were a little hard. The staff could not offer us any information about which direction was west for prayer purposes and could not offer us rugs for prayer either. The juices were a bit expensive, but luckily McDonalds delivers in less than 30 minutes so that was a big plus. You will hear the typical city traffic outside your window. But overall, a great stay. Located close to the MRT at Lavender stop.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: globetrekker728
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Aqueen Hotel Lavender in Singapore for 2 nights. The hotel is newly opened, and thus very clean. Rooms are small, but nicely furnished. The room itself has a large safe, desk, flat panel TV and electronic lighting controls. The bathroom is real small with a shower only, but very clean because it's new. The handyman actually was going around the rooms to install the toilet paper holders. That's how new it was. The hotel is about 5 blocks from the Lavender MTR station, on the same line as the airport. It's next to the other cheap hotels (Fragrance and Hotel 81), but the Aqueen looks the best from outside. There's even a restaurant/bar in the Lobby. The price is very reasonable, compared to high priced hotels on Orchard Road or the Marina. For the price, I'd highly recommend this hotel, especially while it's still new and clean. Hopefully they keep up the interior as it ages.

Reviews.Title: “Wait Here...”
Reviews.Author: MuseumDesign
Reviews.Content: Upon check out "Wait here we will send someone to check to see if you have damaged the room". I know that is what a hotel does, but don't tell me that when I just paid $200+ for my stay. The hotel is still very new and going through teething problems, the staff is nice but inexperienced, the rooms are small. Great location near hawkers stalls. Would look at other hotels for next visit to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Here we could really relax and breathe out”
Reviews.Author: MrAlexS
Reviews.Content: The hotel was only a few weeks old when we stayed. It was very clean and the room was fancy-style with a integrated bathroom (bathroom had glass walls facing the room, if you are tall or stand on the bed, you can look straight into the bathroom - cool, if you trust your room mate..) The only negative part was the poor noice isolation from the room lext door (and some from traffic, but not to bad) Good price (paid 78 dollars), will visit again..

HotelInfo.Name: Aqueen Hotel Lavender
HotelInfo.Address: 139 Lavender Street, Singapore 338739, Singapore
